Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring
Quote: All that is gold does not glitter,Not all those who wander are lost;The old that is strong does not wither,Deep roots are not reached by the frost.From the ashes a fire shall be woken,A light from the shadows shall spring;Renewed shall be blade that was broken,The crownless again shall be king.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  100 Love Sonnets
Quote: I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel
Quote: Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: We love the things we love for what they are.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts.

Author: Plato
Quote: Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?

Author: Chad Sugg,  Monsters Under Your Head
Quote: If you're reading this...Congratulations, you're alive.If that's not something to smile about,then I don't know what is.

Author: Sarah Williams
Quote: I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: Resist much, obey little.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: Unbeing dead isn't being alive.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Some say the world will end in fire,Some say in ice.From what I've tasted of desire,I hold with those who favor fire. But if it had to perish twiceI think I know enough of hateTo say that for destruction iceIs also greatAnd would suffice.

Author: G.K. Chesterton,  Alarms and Discursions
Quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: If you are a dreamer come inIf you are a dreamer a wisher a liarA hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyerIf youre a pretender com sit by my fireFor we have some flax golden tales to spinCome in! Come in!

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,That we may record our emptiness.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,  Wilhelm Meister's Apprenticeship
Quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.

Author: Galway Kinnell
Quote: Let our scars fall in love.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gateAnd though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when IShall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders
Quote: She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood. She only looked away for a moment, and the mask slipped, and you fell. All your tomorrows start here.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on TheeAnd I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.

Author: Charles Darwin,  The Autobiography of Charles Darwin, 1809–82
Quote: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar
Quote: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: This is the way the world endsNot with a bang but a whimper.

Author: Ian Fleming,  You Only Live Twice
Quote: You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face

Author: Charles Baudelaire
Quote: Always be a poet, even in prose.

Author: Seamus Heaney,  Stepping Stones: Interviews with Seamus Heaney
Quote: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.

Author: Kobayashi Issa,  Poems
Quote: What a strange thing!to be alivebeneath cherry blossoms.

Author: Charles Baudelaire
Quote: One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Ho! Ho! Ho! To the bottle I goTo heal my heart and drown my woeRain may fall, and wind may blowAnd many miles be still to goBut under a tall tree will I lieAnd let the clouds go sailing by

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: You might as well ask an artist to explain his art, or ask a poet to explain his poem. It defeats the purpose. The meaning is only clear thorough the search.

Author: Gustave Flaubert
Quote: There is not a particle of life which does not bear poetry within it

Author: Derek Walcott
Quote: Break a vase, and the love that reassembles the fragments is stronger than that love which took its symmetry for granted when it was whole.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  Four Quartets
Quote: We shall not cease from explorationAnd the end of all our exploringWill be to arrive where we startedAnd know the place for the first time.

Author: Osip Mandelstam,  The Selected Poems
Quote: My turn shall also come:I sense the spreading of a wing.

Author: W.H. Auden,  New Year Letter
Quote: Poetry might be defined as the clear expression of mixed feelings.

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
Quote: I have drunken deep of joy,And I will taste no other wine tonight.

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
Quote: I am awaitingperpetually and forevera renaissance of wonder

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.

Author: George Gordon Byron
Quote: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods,There is a rapture on the lonely shore,There is society, where none intrudes,By the deep sea, and music in its roar:I love not man the less, but Nature more

Author: Kobayashi Issa
Quote: Summer night--even the starsare whispering to each other.

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti,  Americus, Book I
Quote: Poetry is eternal graffiti written in the heart of everyone.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: Lovers alone wear sunlight.

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
Quote: Poetry is the shadow cast by our streetlight imaginations.

Author: Wallace Stevens
Quote: Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake.

Author: Mary Oliver,  New and Selected Poems, Vol. 1
Quote: to live in this worldyou must be ableto do three thingsto love what is mortal;to hold itagainst your bones knowingyour own life depends on it;and, when the time comes to let it go,to let it go

Author: Greg Bear
Quote: Once, poets were magicians. Poets were strong, stronger than warriors or kings — stronger than old hapless gods. And they will be strong once again.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: listen: there’s a hellof a good universe next door; let’s go

Author: W.S. Merwin
Quote: Separation Your absence has gone through me Like thread through a needle. Everything I do is stitched with its color.

Author: Theodore Roethke,  Straw for the Fire: From the Notebooks of Theodore Roethke
Quote: Those who are willing to be vulnerable move among mysteries.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: Music is the universal language of mankind.

Author: Marc Wambolt,  Poems from the Heart
Quote: I may not always be with you But when we're far apartRemember you will be with meRight inside my heart

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: Don't use the phone. People are never ready to answer it. Use poetry.

Author: Sarah Williams,  Twilight Hours: A Legacy of Verse
Quote: Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own
Quote: Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  Selected Letters
Quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?

Author: Dylan Thomas,  Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night
Quote: Do not go gentle into that good night,Old age should burn and rave at close of day;Rage, rage against the dying of the light.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: The rain to the wind said,You push and I'll pelt.'They so smote the garden bedThat the flowers actually knelt,And lay lodged--though not dead.I know how the flowers felt.

Author: Gwendolyn Brooks,  Report from Part One
Quote: Live not for Battles Won.Live not for The-End-of-the-Song. Live in the along.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: Love is heavy and light, bright and dark, hot and cold, sick and healthy, asleep and awake- its everything except what it is! (Act 1, scene 1)

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: Love, the poet said, is woman's whole existence.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: I don't care what you say to me. I care what you share with me.

Author: Dorothea Mackellar,  The Poems of Dorothea Mackellar
Quote: I love a sunburnt country,A land of sweeping plains,Of ragged mountain ranges,Of droughts and flooding rains.I love her far horizons,I love her jewel-sea,Her beauty and her terror –The wide brown land for me!

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: Love consists of this: two solitudes that meet, protect and greet each other.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: All my heart is yours, sir: it belongs to you; and with you it would remain, were fate to exile the rest of me from your presence forever.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  Still Another Day
Quote: We the mortals touch the metals,the wind, the ocean shores, the stones,knowing they will go on, inert or burning,and I was discovering, naming all the these things:it was my destiny to love and say goodbye.

Author: Audre Lorde
Quote: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: Extinguish my eyes, I'll go on seeing you.Seal my ears, I'll go on hearing you.And without feet I can make my way to you,without a mouth I can swear your name.Break off my arms, I'll take hold of youwith my heart as with a hand.Stop my heart, and my brain will start to beat.And if you consume my brain with fire,I'll feel you burn in every drop of my blood.

Author: George Gordon Byron
Quote: She walks in beauty, like the nightOf cloudless climes and starry skies;And all that's best of dark and brightMeet in her aspect and her eyes...

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: A woman knows very well that, though a wit sends her his poems, praises her judgment, solicits her criticism, and drinks her tea, this by no means signifies that he respects her opinions, admires her understanding, or will refuse, though the rapier is denied him, to run through the body with his pen.

Author: Vincent van Gogh
Quote: ...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?

Author: William Faulkner,  The Wild Palms
Quote: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
Quote: Tears, idle tears, I know not what they mean, Tears from the depths of some devine despairRise in the heart, and gather to the eyes, In looking on the happy autumn fields, And thinking of the days that are no more.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: She is free in her wildness, she is a wanderess, a drop of free water. She knows nothing of borders and cares nothing for rules or customs. 'Time' for her isn’t something to fight against. Her life flows clean, with passion, like fresh water.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

Author: John Green,  Paper Towns
Quote: Poetry is just so emo."he said. "Oh, the pain. The pain. It always rains. In my soul.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Waste Land
Quote: April is the cruelest month, breedinglilacs out of the dead land, mixingmemory and desire, stirringdull roots with spring rain.

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  Idylls of the King and a Selection of Poems
Quote: Though much is taken, much abides; and thoughWe are not now that strength which in old daysMoved earth and heaven, that which we are, we are;One equal temper of heroic hearts,Made weak by time and fate, but strong in willTo strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield.

Author: Rumi
Quote: I know you're tired but come, this is the way.

Author: Sara Teasdale,  The Collected Poems
Quote: Stephen kissed me in the spring,Robin in the fall,But Colin only looked at meAnd never kissed at all.Stephen’s kiss was lost in jest,Robin’s lost in play,But the kiss in Colin’s eyesHaunts me night and day.

Author: W.B. Yeats,  The Collected Poems of W.B. Yeats
Quote: Come away, O human child!To the waters and the wildWith a faery, hand in hand,For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand.

Author: Dylan Thomas
Quote: A good poem is a contribution to reality. The world is never the same once a good poem has been added to it. A good poem helps to change the shape of the universe, helps to extend everyone's knowledge of himself and the world around him.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: Some of you say, “Joy is greater than sorrow,” and others say, “Nay, sorrow is the greater.”But I say unto you, they are inseparable.Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed.

Author: Arthur Rimbaud,  A Season in Hell/The Drunken Boat
Quote: I turned silences and nights into words. What was unutterable, I wrote down. I made the whirling world stand still.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  Twenty Love Poems and a Song of Despair
Quote: I am no longer in love with her, that's certain, but maybe I love her. Love is so short, forgetting is so long.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: You give but little when you give of your possessions.It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: The death of a beautiful woman is, unquestionably, the most poetical topic in the world.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: Poetry, she thought, wasn't written to be analyzed; it was meant to inspire without reason, to touch without understanding.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: To be a poet is a condition, not a profession.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  A Few Figs from Thistles
Quote: My candle burns at both ends;It will not last the night;But ah, my foes, and oh, my friends—It gives a lovely light!

Author: Mary Oliver,  Owls and Other Fantasies: Poems and Essays
Quote: I want to think again of dangerous and noble things. I want to be light and frolicsome. I want to be improbable beautiful and afraid of nothing, as though I had wings.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Shakespeare's Sonnets
Quote: Love is not loveWhich alters when it alteration finds,Or bends with the remover to remove.O no, it is an ever-fixed markThat looks on tempests and is never shaken;It is the star to every wand'ring bark,Whose worth's unknown, although his height be taken."(Sonnet 116)

Author: W.H. Auden,  Selected Poems
Quote: The stars are not wanted now: put out every one;Pack up the moon and dismantle the sun;Pour away the ocean and sweep up the wood.For nothing now can ever come to any good.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: If I can see pain in your eyes then share with me your tears. If I can see joy in your eyes then share with me your smile.

Author: Erin Hanson
Quote: There is freedom waiting for you,On the breezes of the sky,And you ask "What if I fall?"Oh but my darling,What if you fly?

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: may came home with a smooth round stoneas small as a world and as large as alone.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: life's not a paragraphAnd death i think is no parenthesis

Author: Charles Bukowski,  War All the Time
Quote: some moments are nice, some arenicer, some are even worthwritingabout.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion.

Author: Janet Fitch,  White Oleander
Quote: Always learn poems by heart. They have to become the marrow in your bones. Like fluoride in the water, they'll make your soul impervious to the world's soft decay.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Though nothing can bring back the hourOf splendor in the grass, of glory in the flower;We will grieve not, rather findStrength in what remains behind;In the primal sympathyWhich having been must ever be...

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: I'm nobody! Who are you? Are you nobody, too? Then there ’s a pair of us—don’t tell! They ’d banish us, you know. How dreary to be somebody! How public, like a frog To tell your name the livelong day To an admiring bog!

Author: Daphne Gottlieb,  Why Things Burn
Quote: you can take this mouththis wound you wantbut you can't kissand make itbetter.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  Twenty Love Poems and a Song of Despair
Quote: It was at that agethat poetry came in search of me.

Author: John Keats
Quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.

Author: E.E. Cummings,  Selected Poems
Quote: i carry your heart with me(i carry it in my heart)

Author: Jim Morrison,  Letters from Joe
Quote: There are things known and there are things unknownand in between are the doors.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Collected Poems
Quote: I lean to you, numb as a fossil. Tell me I'm here.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: Peace is always beautiful.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: Dare to love yourselfas if you were a rainbowwith gold at both ends.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Letters to a Young Poet
Quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for to the creator there is no poverty and no poor indifferent place.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination.

Author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality
Quote: Closed in a room, my imagination becomes the universe, and the rest of the world is missing out.

Author: Rumi
Quote: The breezes at dawn have secrets to tell youDon't go back to sleep!You must ask for what you really want.Don't go back to sleep!People are going back and forth across the doorsill where the two worlds touch,The door is round and openDon't go back to sleep!

Author: Anne Brontë,  Best Poems of the Brontë Sisters
Quote: I love the silent hour of night,For blissful dreams may then arise,Revealing to my charmed sightWhat may not bless my waking eyes.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: Love one another, but make not a bond of love:Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.

Author: W.H. Auden,  Collected Poems
Quote: He was my North, my South, my East and West,My working week and my Sunday rest,My noon, my midnight, my talk, my song;I thought that love would last forever: I was wrong.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: The bridge will only take you halfway there, to those mysterious lands you long to see. Through gypsy camps and swirling Arab fair, and moonlit woods where unicorns run free. So come and walk awhile with me and share the twisting trails and wondrous worlds I've known. But this bridge will only take you halfway there. The last few steps you have to take alone.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
Quote: Into the darkness they go, the wise and the lovely.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Song of Myself
Quote: I discover myself on the verge of a usual mistake.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: O serpent heart hid with a flowering face!Did ever a dragon keep so fair a cave?Beautiful tyrant, feind angelical, dove feather raven, wolvish-ravening lamb! Despised substance of devinest show, just opposite to what thou justly seemest - A dammed saint, an honourable villain!

Author: Leonard Cohen
Quote: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Julius Caesar
Quote: Why, man, he doth bestride the narrow worldLike a Colossus; and we petty menWalk under his huge legs, and peep aboutTo find ourselves dishonourable graves.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: The heart can think of no devotionGreater than being shore to the ocean-Holding the curve of one position,Counting an endless repetition.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  A Man Without a Country
Quote: I wanted all thingsTo seem to make some sense,So we could all be happy, yes,Instead of tense.And I made up liesSo that they all fit nice,And I made this sad worldA par-a-dise.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: A Word is DeadA word is deadWhen it is said,Some say.I say it justBegins to liveThat day.

Author: S.E. Hinton,  The Outsiders
Quote: Nothing Stay Forever""Nature’s first green is gold,"Her hardest hue to hold."Her early leaf’s a flower;"But only so an hour."Then leaf subsides to leaf."So Eden sank to grief,"So dawn goes down today."Nothing gold can stay.-- Robert Frost

Author: Novalis
Quote: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason.

Author: Sara Teasdale,  The Collected Poems
Quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise.

Author: Mae West
Quote: You are never too old to become younger!

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.But you are eternity and you are the mirror.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: I went down to the river,I set down on the bank.I tried to think but couldn't,So I jumped in and sank.

Author: Jasper Fforde,  First Among Sequels
Quote: Whereas story is processed in the mind in a straightforward manner, poetry bypasses rational thought and goes straight to the limbic system and lights it up like a brushfire. It's the crack cocaine of the literary world.

Author: John Boyle O'Reilly,  Life of John Boyle O'Reilly
Quote: Be silent and safe — silence never betrays you; Be true to your word and your work and your friend; Put least trust in him who is foremost to praise you,Nor judge of a road till it draw to the end.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: How happy is the little stoneThat rambles in the road alone,And doesn't care about careers,And exigencies never fears;Whose coat of elemental brownA passing universe put on;And independent as the sun,Associates or glows alone,Fulfilling absolute decreeIn casual simplicity.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want
Quote: I want to create a seventeen-syllable word that encompasses the human condition, and then use that word to form the world’s most perfect haiku.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  Ballads and Other Poems
Quote: Be still, sad heart! and cease repining;Behind the clouds is the sun still shining;Thy fate is the common fate of all,Into each life some rain must fall

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: Still, what I want in my lifeis to be willingto be dazzled—to cast aside the weight of factsand maybe evento float a littleabove this difficult world.

Author: Cate Tiernan
Quote: There is darkness in light, there is pain in joy, and there are thorns on the rose.

Author: Tyler Knott Gregson,  Love Language
Quote: I would love to saythat youmake meweak in the kneesbutto be quite upfrontand completelytruthfulyoumake my bodyforgetit has kneesat all.

Author: Matthew Arnold,  Dover Beach and Other Poems
Quote: Ah, love, let us be true To one another! for the world, which seems To lie before us like a land of dreams, So various, so beautiful, so new, Hath really neither joy, nor love, nor light, Nor certitude, nor peace, nor help for pain; And we are here as on a darkling plain Swept with confused alarms of struggle and flight, Where ignorant armies clash by night.

Author: Nayyirah Waheed
Quote: younot wanting mewasthe beginning of mewanting myselfthank you

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: I hunger for your sleek laugh and your hands the color of a furious harvest. I want to eat the sunbeams flaring in your beauty.

Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
Quote: Falling in love is very real, but I used to shake my head when people talked about soul mates, poor deluded individuals grasping at some supernatural ideal not intended for mortals but sounded pretty in a poetry book. Then, we met, and everything changed, the cynic has become the converted, the sceptic, an ardent zealot.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  Poems: 1909-1925
Quote: We are the hollow menWe are the stuffed menLeaning togetherHeadpiece filled with straw. Alas!Our dried voices, whenWe whisper togetherAre quiet and meaninglessAs wind in dry grassOr rats' feet over broken glassIn our dry cellarShape without form, shade without colour,Paralysed force, gesture without motion;- The Hollow Men

Author: W.H. Auden,  The Complete Works of W.H. Auden: Prose, Volume II: 1939-1948
Quote: A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: So dawn goes down today... Nothing gold can stay.-- Robert Frost

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: You fit into melike a hook into an eyea fish hookan open eye

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  The Complete Works of Alfred Tennyson
Quote: Once in a golden hour I cast to earth a seed. Up there came a flower, The people said, a weed.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Time for you and time for me, And time yet for a hundred indecisions, And for a hundred visions and revisions, Before the taking of a toast and tea.

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: A truth should exist,it should not be usedlike this. If I love youis that a fact or a weapon?

Author: George Eliot,  O May I Join the Choir Invisible! And Other Favourite Poems
Quote: O may I join the choir invisibleOf those immortal dead who live againIn minds made better by their presence; liveIn pulses stirred to generosity,In deeds of daring rectitude...

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Poetry is the rhythmical creation of beauty in words.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: When you part from your friend, you grieve not;For that which you love most in him may be clearer in his absence, asthe mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love flows like flowers, and grows like water. I’m so thirsty for romance I could drink a dozen roses.

Author: W.H. Auden
Quote: You shall love your crooked neighbour, with your crooked heart.

Author: Raymond Carver,  A New Path to the Waterfall
Quote: Late FragmentAnd did you get whatyou wanted from this life, even so?I did.And what did you want?To call myself beloved, to feel myselfbeloved on the earth.

Author: William Blake,  Jerusalem
Quote: I must create a system, or be enslaved by another man's. I will not reason and compare: my business is to create.

Author: Andrea Gibson
Quote: That night when you kissed me, I left a poem in your mouth, and you can hear some of the lines every time you breathe out.

Author: Stephen Crane,  The Black Riders and Other Lines
Quote: In the DesertIn the desert I saw a creature, naked, bestial, Who, squatting upon the ground, Held his heart in his hands, And ate of it. I said, “Is it good, friend?” “It is bitter—bitter,” he answered; “But I like it “Because it is bitter, “And because it is my heart.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My brain is divided into two butterflies, and both are in love with your rose-shaped heart. If you've got the garden, I've got my whole life.

Author: Judith Minty,  Letters to My Daughters
Quote: I give you this to take with you:Nothing remains as it was. If you know this, you canbegin again, with pure joy in the uprooting.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Unreturned love is like trying to make a sandwich with one slice of bread. Don’t stress—fold it in half and love yourself.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Complete Poems
Quote: What if you slept?What if you slept And what if In your sleep You dreamed And what if In your dream You went to heaven And there plucked a strange and beautiful flower And what if When you awoke You had that flower in you hand Ah, what then?

Author: Alexander Pushkin
Quote: I have outlasted all desire,My dreams and I have grown apart;My grief alone is left entire,The gleamings of an empty heart.The storms of ruthless dispensationHave struck my flowery garland numb,I live in lonely desolationAnd wonder when my end will come.Thus on a naked tree-limb, blastedBy tardy winter's whistling chill,A single leaf which has outlastedIts season will be trembling still.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: She has a sly smile, and eyes that seem to see my essence as they explore my soul and implore my spirit to enter her. I look at her and I see love.

Author: W.B. Yeats
Quote: What can be explained is not poetry.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  Selected Poems
Quote: There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands awayNor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest takeWithout oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul.

Author: Nikki Giovanni
Quote: I love you because no two snowflakes are alike, and it is possible, if you stand tippy-toe, to walk between the raindrops.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Life, it’s made up of two things—time and love. A watch tells one, but what tells the other? We tell each other.

Author: John Keats,  The Complete Poems
Quote: Beauty is truth, truth beauty,—that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know

Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Letter to Andre Breton, Originally Composed on a Leaf of Lettuce With an Ink-dipped Carrot
Quote: Here's a haiku/palindrome I wrote called, "Obsession."Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob,Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob,Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob

Author: Pablo Neruda,  100 Love Sonnets
Quote: I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets. Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: To pay attention, this is our endless and proper work.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: To elevate the soul, poetry is necessary.

Author: Clementine von Radics
Quote: All this timeI drank you like the cure when maybeyou were the poison.

Author: Aberjhani,  Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love
Quote: The words ‘I Love You’ kill, and resurrect millions, in less than a second.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Like a sculptor, if necessary,carve a friend out of stone.Realize that your inner sight is blindand try to see a treasure in everyone.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Our love went from fly to flower to butterfly, and it was meant to beautifully flutter, not sit still on a shelf like a trophy to be collected.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  100 Love Sonnets
Quote: Green was the silence, wet was the light,the month of June trembled like a butterfly.

Author: Mary Oliver,  Thirst
Quote: The Uses Of Sorrow(In my sleep I dreamed this poem)Someone I loved once gave mea box full of darkness.It took me years to understandthat this, too, was a gift.

Author: Maya Angelou,  Phenomenal Woman: Four Poems Celebrating Women
Quote: It’s the fire in my eyes, And the flash of my teeth, The swing in my waist, And the joy in my feet. I’m a woman Phenomenally.

Author: Sherman Alexie,  One Stick Song
Quote: Poetry = Anger x Imagination

Author: Mario Benedetti
Quote: Five minutes are enough to dream a whole life, that is how relative time is.

Author: Langston Hughes,  Selected Poems
Quote: Looks like what drives me crazyDon't have no effect on you--But I'm gonna keep on at itTill it drives you crazy, too.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: twice I have lived forever in a smile

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The darkness has ink eyes, and if you stare long enough, you’re going to see it blink black. That’s the moment to start writing.

Author: Stephen Crane,  War Is Kind and Other Poems
Quote: A Man Said to the UniverseA man said to the universe: “Sir, I exist!”“However,” replied the universe, “The fact has not created in me A sense of obligation.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: PHOSPHORESCENCE. Now there's a word to lift your hat to... to find that phosphorescence, that light within, that's the genius behind poetry.

Author: George Eliot,  Middlemarch
Quote: It is always fatal to have music or poetry interrupted.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My hands will get dirty holding your rose-shaped heart, because love is like gardening—it’s earthy and takes work to keep it alive.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love isn’t in a hurry like a flurry of flowery words on paper. It’s lush and slow to grow its aroma in the garden of time.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I don’t want my love with her to wither like grapes on a vine, so I’ll water it with romance to turn it into wine.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’ll wear a maze on a necklace, dangling over my chest, because if you want to get at my heart, you have to be ready to lose yourself.

Author: Mary Oliver,  A Poetry Handbook
Quote: Poetry is a life-cherishing force. For poems are not words, after all, but fires for the cold, ropes let down to the lost, something as necessary as bread in the pockets of the hungry.

Author: Anna Akhmatova,  The Complete Poems of Anna Akhmatova
Quote: You will hear thunder and remember me, And think: she wanted storms. The rim Of the sky will be the colour of hard crimson, And your heart, as it was then, will be on fire.

Author: Shel Silverstein,  Falling Up
Quote: why can't you see i'm a kid', said the kid.Why try to make me like you?Why are you hurt when I don't cuddle?Why do you sigh when I splash through a puddle?Why do you scream when I do what I did?Im a kid.

Author: William Blake
Quote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A flowing flurry of flowers fell to the floor when I fell in love, as if my heart were a garden that gushed forth and flooded her being with the fragrance of romance.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Instead of reciting her an original love poem using words, I think I’ll use my tongue to more creatively explore the deepest parts of her.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The middle finger is a great body language tool for letting people know you’re upset. Poetry isn’t quite as effective in a fit of road rage.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: If you want me again look for me under your boot soles.

Author: Omar Khayyám
Quote: The Moving Finger writes; and, having writ,Moves on: nor all thy Piety nor WitShall lure it back to cancel half a Line,Nor all thy Tears wash out a Word of it.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Our love will blend together like turquoise is blue and green. There’s no depression or envy when both blur into one.

Author: Joseph Brodsky
Quote: For darkness restores what light cannot repair.

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  Poems of Fernando Pessoa
Quote: To be great, be whole;Exclude nothing, exaggerate nothing that is not you.Be whole in everything. Put all you areInto the smallest thing you do.So, in each lake, the moon shines with splendorBecause it blooms up above.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin
Quote: My imagination makes me human and makes me a fool; it gives me all the world and exiles me from it.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Flower petals in the breeze look like a butterfly flapping its wings. My love for you takes flight like a white orchid blushing pink.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.The teacher who walks in the shadow of the temple, among his followers, gives not of his wisdom but rather of his faith and his lovingness.If he is indeed wise he does not bid you enter the house of his wisdom, but rather leads you to the threshold of your own mind.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: You have been told that, even like a chain, you are as weak as your weakest link.This is but half the truth.You are also as strong as your strongest link.To measure you by your smallest deed is to reckon the power of the oceanby the frailty of its foam.To judge you by your failures is to cast blame upon the seasons for their inconstancy.

Author: Langston Hughes,  The Collected Poems
Quote: HarlemWhat happens to a dream deferred?Does it dry up like a raisin in the sun? Or fester like a sore-- And then run? Does it stink like rotten meat? Or crust and sugar over-- like a syrupy sweet?Maybe it just sags like a heavy load.Or does it explode?

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: Listen, real poetry doesn't say anything; it just ticks off the possibilities. Opens all doors. You can walk through anyone that suits you.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My heartbeat is a pulse, and it pumps out sonic vibrations that resonate with her mind as she lays her head on my chest. Listen silently and you can hear the frequency of love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Last night my shadow exploded into hundreds of fluttering black birds, foreshadowing my love taking flight under the cover of camouflage.

Author: Nick Hornby,  How to Be Good
Quote: It seems to me now that the plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone.

Author: Ntozake Shange
Quote: i found god in myselfand i loved heri loved her fiercely

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Rilke's Book of Hours: Love Poems to God
Quote: If we surrenderedto earth's intelligencewe could rise up rooted, like trees.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: We wanderers, ever seeking the lonelier way, begin no day where we have ended another day; and no sunrise finds us where sunset left us. Even while the earth sleeps we travel. We are the seeds of the tenacious plant, and it is in our ripeness and our fullness of heart that we are given to the wind and are scattered.

Author: W.B. Yeats
Quote: Out of the quarrel with others we make rhetoric; out of the quarrel with ourselves we make poetry.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: i do not know what it is about you that closesand opens;only something in me understandsthe voice of your eyes is deeper than all roses

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: Go wisely and slowly. Those who rush stumble and fall.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: One need not be a chamber to be haunted.

Author: Meher Baba
Quote: Don't Worry Be Happy

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: There's an old saying that applies to me: you can't lose a game if you don't play the game. (Act 1, scene 4)

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

Author: Richard Siken,  Crush
Quote: If you love me, Henry, you don’t love me in a way I understand.

Author: George Gordon Byron,  Childe Harold's Pilgrimage
Quote: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods,There is a rapture on the lonely shore,There is society, where none intrudes,By the deep Sea, and music in its roar:I love not Man the less, but Nature more,From these our interviews, in which I stealFrom all I may be, or have been before,To mingle with the Universe, and feelWhat I can ne’er express, yet cannot all conceal.

Author: أمل دنقل,  تعليق على ما حدث
Quote: قلت لكم مراراإن الطوابير التي تمر..في استعراض عيد الفطر والجلاء(فتهتف النساء في النوافذ انبهارا)لا تصنع انتصارا.إن المدافع التي تصطف على الحدود، في الصحارىلا تطلق النيران.. إلا حين تستدير للوراء.إن الرصاصة التي ندفع فيها.. ثمن الكسرة والدواء:لا تقتل الأعداءلكنها تقتلنا.. إذا رفعنا صوتنا جهاراتقتلنا، وتقتل الصغارا !

Author: Rumi
Quote: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field.I'll meet you there.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Duino Elegies
Quote: Every angel is terrifying.

Author: John Donne,  The Complete English Poems
Quote: I am two fools, I know,For loving, and for saying so.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: We ran as if to meet the moon.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: I live not in dreams but in contemplation of a reality that is perhaps the future.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: It is always what I have already said: always the wish that you may find patience enough in yourself to endure, and simplicity enough to believe; that you may acquire more and more confidence in that which is difficult, and in your solitude among others. And for the rest, let life happen to you. Believe me: life is right, in any case.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: If I waste all my charity, all I’ll wind up with in the end is the wind. Still, I think I want to be the Dandelion of Love.

Author: Matsuo Bashō
Quote: Winter solitude-in a world of one colourthe sound of the wind.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotion know what it means to want to escape from these.

Author: Roman Payne,  The Wanderess
Quote: I was an adventurer, but she was not an adventuress. She was a 'wanderess.' Thus, she didn’t care about money, only experiences - whether they came from wealth or from poverty, it was all the same to her.

Author: William Shakespeare,  The Passionate Pilgrim
Quote: He that is thy friend indeed,He will help thee in thy need:If thou sorrow, he will weep;If thou wake, he cannot sleep:Thus of every grief in heartHe with thee doth bear a part.These are certain signs to knowFaithful friend from flattering foe.

Author: W.B. Yeats,  The Collected Poems of W.B. Yeats
Quote: Turning and turning in the widening gyreThe falcon cannot hear the falconer;Things fall apart; the centre cannot hold;Mere anarchy is loosed upon the world,The blood-dimmed tide is loosed, and everywhereThe ceremony of innocence is drowned;The best lack all conviction, while the worstAre full of passionate intensity.

Author: Christopher Poindexter
Quote: Sometimes I sit alone under the stars and think of the galaxies inside my heart and truly wonder if anyone will ever want to make sense of all that I am

Author: Andrea Gibson,  The Madness Vase: By Andrea Gibson
Quote: My mouth is a fire escape.The words coming outdon’t care that they are naked.There is something burning in there.

Author: E.E. Cummings,  Complete Poems, 1904-1962
Quote: since the thing perhaps isto eat flowers and not to be afraid

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: You darkness, that I come from,I love you more than all the firesthat fence in the world,for the fire makesa circle of light for everyone,and then no one outside learns of you.But the darkness pulls in everything:shapes and fires, animals and myself,how easily it gathers them! -powers and people -and it is possible a great energyis moving near me.I have faith in nights.

Author: William Wordsworth,  Lyrical Ballads
Quote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: The way a crowShook down on meThe dust of snowFrom a hemlock treeHas given my heartA change of moodAnd saved some partOf a day I had rued.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: She was a beautiful dreamer. The kind of girl, who kept her head in the clouds, loved above the stars and left regret beneath the earth she walked on.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Lovers find secret placesinside this violent worldwhere they make transactions with beauty.

Author: William Blake
Quote: Truth can never be told so as to be understood and not be believed.

Author: Robert Browning Hamilton
Quote: I walked a mile with Pleasure;She chatted all the way;But left me none the wiserFor all she had to say.I walked a mile with Sorrow;And ne’er a word said she;But, oh! The things I learned from her,When Sorrow walked with me.

Author: E.E. Cummings,  100 Selected Poems
Quote: when man determined to destroy himself he picked the was of shall and finding only why smashed it into because

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: I too am not a bit tamed, I too am untranslatable, I sound my barbaric yawp over the roofs of the world.

Author: Salman Rushdie
Quote: A poet's work . . . to name the unnamable, to point at frauds, to take sides, start arguments, shape the world and stop it from going to sleep.

Author: Randall Jarrell
Quote: A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times.

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another til I drop.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: You have played, (I think) And broke the toys you were fondest of, And are a little tired now; Tired of things that break, and— Just tired. So am I.

Author: Mario Benedetti
Quote: Cada vez que te enamores no expliques a nadie nada, deja que el amor te invada sin entrar en pormenores

Author: John Keats
Quote: Whatever the imagination seizes as Beauty must be truth -whether it existed before or not

Author: Flora Jessop,  Church of Lies
Quote: To those who abuse: the sin is yours, the crime is yours, and the shame is yours. To those who protect the perpetrators: blaming the victims only masks the evil within, making you as guilty as those who abuse. Stand up for the innocent or go down with the rest.

Author: Veronica Franco,  Poems and Selected Letters
Quote: So sweet and delicious do I become,when I am in bed with a manwho, I sense, loves and enjoys me,that the pleasure I bring excels all delight,so the knot of love, however tightit seemed before, is tied tighter still.

Author: Truman Capote,  Truman Capote: Conversations
Quote: To me, the greatest pleasure of writing is not what it's about, but the music the words make.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: She plants love, and she grows roses. The fragrance of romance comes from the blossom that blooms in the heart.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The roses of romance grow when you water your relationship with gratitude. Love will bloom and blossom when you recognize the awesome.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Nature never did betrayThe heart that loved her.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself, And what I assume you shall assume,For every atom belonging to me as good belongs to you.

Author: pleasefindthis,  I Wrote This For You
Quote: You had this expression on your face, like you weren’t quite sure you were supposed to be on Earth.

Author: Allen Ginsberg
Quote: I really believe, or want to believe, really I am nuts, otherwise I'll never be sane.

Author: W.B. Yeats,  The Collected Poems of W.B. Yeats
Quote: How many loved your moments of glad grace,  And loved your beauty with love false or true;  But one man loved the pilgrim soul in you, And loved the sorrows of your changing face.

Author: William Carlos Williams
Quote: This is Just to Say I have eatenthe plumsthat were inthe iceboxand whichyou were probablysavingfor breakfastForgive methey were deliciousso sweetand so cold

Author: Charlotte Eriksson,  Empty Roads & Broken Bottles; in search for The Great Perhaps
Quote: So for now,I will miss you like I’ll never see you again,And the next time I see you,I will kiss you like I’ll never kiss you again,And when I fall asleep beside you I will fall asleep as if I’ll never wake up again,because I don’t know if I will.I don’t know if I will.- I Will Love You Like The World Is Ending

Author: Rumi
Quote: I will soothe you and heal you,I will bring you roses.I too have been covered with thorns.

Author: Ezra Pound
Quote: Speak against unconscious oppression,Speak against the tyranny of the unimaginative,Speak against bonds.

Author: Tim Burton
Quote: The Girl With Many EyesOne day in the parkI had quite a surprise.I met a girlwho had many eyes.She was really quite pretty(and also quite shocking!)and I noticed she had a mouth,so we ended up talking.We talked about flowers,and her poetry classes,and the problems she'd haveif she ever wore glasses.It's great to know a girlwho has so many eyes,but you really get wetwhen she breaks down and cries.

Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice
Quote: I have been used to consider poetry as "the food of love"said Darcy."Of a fine, stout, healthy love it may. Everything nourishes what isstrong already. But if it be only a slight, thin sort of inclination, Iam convinced that one good sonnet will starve it entirely away.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: White letters plus white paper equals invisibility. Just because you can’t see my love for you, doesn’t mean I didn’t write about it.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: To hide feelings when you are near crying is the secret of dignity.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Let me just pause a minute and drink in this moment. And if you film it, I’ll be able to get free refills for life.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: Hope is the thing with feathersThat perches in the soul,And sings the tune without the words,And never stops at all,And sweetest in the gale is heard;And sore must be the stormThat could abash the little birdThat kept so many warm.I've heard it in the chilliest landAnd on the strangest sea;Yet, never, in extremity,It asked a crumb of me.

Author: Karen Quan,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: She was stuck in between two worlds while her heart was pulling them both together. In a perfect world, she'd have both, or none at all. The symbol for love is two circles trying to merge in a Venn diagram that comes to a point down below, and only mostly separate are the two orbs one whole heart.-Karen Quan and Jarod Kintz

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  In Memoriam
Quote: I hold it true, whate'er befall;I feel it when I sorrow most;'Tis better to have loved and lostThan never to have loved at all.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: I want to see thirstIn the syllables,Tough fireIn the sound;Feel through the darkFor the scream.

Author: Amanda Mosher,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: When the world is cold, use bridges for firewood. And for extra warmth, give off an aura of love, and you won't need a bridge, because the other side will come to you.-Amanda Mosher and Jarod Kintz

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The Sacred and The Scared. Which of these two categories does your love fall under? I should write a love poem on a rolled-up scroll so you’d know which one categorizes mine.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: A poem begins with a lump in the throat; a homesickness or a love sickness. It is a reaching-out toward expression; an effort to find fulfillment. A complete poem is one where an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Rime of the Ancient Mariner
Quote: Water, water, everywhere,And all the boards did shrink;Water, water, everywhere,Nor any drop to drink.

Author: William Carlos Williams,  Paterson
Quote: We sit and talk,quietly, with long lapses of silenceand I am aware of the streamthat has no language, coursingbeneath the quiet heaven ofyour eyeswhich has no speech

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I just bought a bag of poetry, but it was mostly air. The author must have learned from the potato chip industry.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Read her poetry before you make love to her. That way she’ll be asleep when you do. I’m as romantic as a rocking chair with wheels.

Author: Lang Leav
Quote: Love is a game of tic-tac-toe,constantly waitingfor the next x or o.

Author: L.J. Smith,  Night World, No. 3
Quote: People Die...Beauty Fades...Love Changes...And You Will Always Be Alone

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: Poetry puts starch in your backbone so you can stand, so you can compose your life.

Author: Tim Burton
Quote: Voodoo GirlHer skin is white cloth,and she's all sewn apartand she has many colored pinssticking out of her heart.She has many different zombieswho are deeply in her trance.She even has a zombiewho was originally from France.But she knows she has a curse on her,a curse she cannot win.For if someone getstoo close to her,the pins stick farther in.

Author: Nayyirah Waheed
Quote: no’ might make them angrybut it will make you free.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: When I go off the grid, my main source of light will be fireflies. Oh, and the glow that will come from the epic love poem I am writing for you.

Author: Amanda Mosher,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: Angels walk amongst those with broken wings. Those with broken wings only need to be given a little love before their hearts can flutter and take flight once again.-Amanda Mosher and Jarod Kintz

Author: T.S. Eliot,  Four Quartets
Quote: Time present and time pastAre both perhaps present in time futureAnd time future contained in time past.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: Each star is a mirror reflecting the truth inside you.

Author: Alexander Pope,  An Essay on Criticism
Quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing.Drink deep, or taste not the Pierian Spring;There shallow draughts intoxicate the brain,and drinking largely sobers us again.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Never cry because you have mountains of problem in your hands to solve. Always smile because each problems will someday resolve.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: We join spokes together in a wheel, but it is the center hole that makes the wagon move.We shape clay into a pot, but it is the emptiness insidethat holds whatever we want.We hammer wood for a house, but it is the inner spacethat makes it livable.We work with being, but non-being is what we use.

Author: Karen Quan,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: I'll sleep forever and meet you in my dreams; it'll hurt less anyway. But the pain of losing you was worth the pleasure of having you, and I rest in bed knowing you'll know for the rest of your life what you are missing.-Karen Quan and Jarod Kintz

Author: Ted Hughes,  Birthday Letters
Quote: Nobody wanted your dance,Nobody wanted your strange glitter, your flounderingDrowning life and your effort to save yourself,Treading water, dancing the dark turmoil,Looking for something to give.

Author: Wallace Stevens
Quote: I do not know which to prefer,The beauty of inflectionsOr the beauty of innuendosThe blackbird whistlingOr just after.

Author: Karen Quan,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: I'll miss looking through the forest–your green and hazel eyes. I love the way they shimmered and changed shade with your mood, and how I could see the desire in your emerald gaze.-Karen Quan and Jarod Kintz

Author: Mary Oliver,  A Thousand Mornings
Quote: I Go Down To The ShoreI go down to the shore in the morningand depending on the hour the wavesare rolling in or moving out,and I say, oh, I am miserable,what shall—what should I do? And the sea saysin its lovely voice:Excuse me, I have work to do.

Author: W.B. Yeats,  The Wind Among the Reeds
Quote: I bring you with reverent handsThe books of my numberless dreams.

Author: W.H. Auden,  The Age of Anxiety: A Baroque Eclogue
Quote: We would rather be ruined than changedWe would rather die in our dreadThan climb the cross of the momentAnd let our illusions die.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: your handtouching mine.this is howgalaxiescollide.

Author: Tyler Knott Gregson
Quote: Some days I wake upand all I feelare the fracturesin the flesh that coversthe only meI've ever known.Some days,it's those exact fissuresthat let the lighthiding inside mepour outand coverin goldeveryonethat found enough beautyin the cracksto standclose.

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  Poems of Fernando Pessoa
Quote: If after I die, people want to write my biography, there is nothing simpler. They only need two dates: the date of my birth and the date of my death. Between one and another, every day is mine.

Author: Alexander Pope,  Moral Essays
Quote: Wise wretch! with pleasures too refined to please,With too much spirit to be e'er at ease,With too much quickness ever to be taught,With too much thinking to have common thought:You purchase pain with all that joy can give,And die of nothing but a rage to live.

Author: Richard Siken,  Crush
Quote: Here is the repeated image of the lover destroyed.

Author: Omar Khayyám
Quote: I sent my Soul through the Invisible, Some letter of that After-life to spell: And by and by my Soul return'd to me, And answer'd: 'I Myself am Heav'n and Hell

Author: Aberjhani,  Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love
Quote: This fire that we call Loving is too strong for human minds. But just right for human souls.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Edgar Allan Poe: Selected Poems
Quote: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary, Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore — While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping, As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
Quote: Poetry: the best words in the best order.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock and Other Poems
Quote: And would it have been worth it, after all,Would it have been worth while,After the sunsets and the dooryards and the sprinkled streets, After the novels, after the teacups, after the skirts that trail along the floor - And this, and so much more? -

Author: Leonard Cohen,  Book of Longing
Quote: first of all nothing will happen and a little laternothing will happen again

Author: Kobayashi Issa
Quote: HereI'm here-the snow falling.

Author: Dylan Thomas,  Fern Hill
Quote: ...Time held me green and dyingThough I sang in my chains like the sea.

Author: Allen Ginsberg
Quote: Democracy! Bah! When I hear that I reach for my feather boa!

Author: John Milton,  The Complete Poetry
Quote: What needs my Shakespeare for his honoured bones,The labor of an age in pilèd stones,Or that his hallowed relics should be hidUnder a star-y-pointing pyramid?Dear son of memory, great heir of fame,What need'st thou such weak witness of thy name?

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti,  Poetry as Insurgent Art
Quote: Poetry is a naked woman, a naked man, and the distance between them.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  The Harp-Weaver and Other Poems
Quote: Pity me that the heart is slow to learnWhat the swift mind beholds at every turn.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: the stars began to burnthrough the sheets of clouds,and there was a new voicewhich you slowlyrecognized as your own

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: Poetry is an act of peace. Peace goes into the making of a poet as flour goes into the making of bread.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: LightLightThe visible reminder of Invisible Light.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: Was not writing poetry a secret transaction, a voice answering a voice?

Author: Sylvia Plath,  Ariel
Quote: I am terrified by this dark thingThat sleeps in me;All day I feel its soft, feathery turnings, its malignity.

Author: John Fowles,  The Magus
Quote: To write poetry and to commit suicide, apparently so contradictory, had really been the same, attempts at escape.

Author: Ovid
Quote: I am the poet of the poor, because I was poor when I loved; since I could not give gifts, I gave words.

Author: Mark Strand,  Selected Poems
Quote: Ink runs from the corners of my mouth.There is no happiness like mine.I have been eating poetry.

Author: Joanne Harris,  Chocolat
Quote: I could do with a bit more excess. From now on I'm going to be immoderate--and volatile--I shall enjoy loud music and lurid poetry. I shall be rampant.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: The difference between the poet and the mathematician is that the poet tries to get his head into the heavens while the mathematician tries to get the heavens into his head.

Author: P.C. Cast
Quote: See with your soul and not your eyesbecause to dance with the beasts youmust penetrate their disguise.

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
Quote: Recipe For Happiness Khaborovsk Or Anyplace'One grand boulevard with treeswith one grand cafe in sunwith strong black coffee in very small cups.One not necessarily very beautifulman or woman who loves you.One fine day.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: A billion stars go spinning through the night, / glittering above your head, / But in you is the presence that will be / when all the stars are dead.

Author: Jim Carroll
Quote: Conscience is no more than the dead speaking to us.

Author: Cassandra Clare
Quote: But you hate poetry!Yes, but you make me want to write it.

Author: Dante Alighieri
Quote: A mighty flame follows a tiny spark.

Author: Allen Ginsberg
Quote: If I had a soul I sold itfor pretty wordsIf I had a body I usedit up spurting my essenceAllen Ginsberg warns youdont follow my pathto extinction

Author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox,  Poems of Passion
Quote: Laugh, and the world laughs with you;Weep, and you weep alone;For the sad old earth must borrow its mirth,But has trouble enough of its own.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..
Quote: A poem for Beth: Roses are red, Violets are blue, I didn’t know what love meant, until I looked it up in the dictionary.

Author: Frank O'Hara,  Meditations in an Emergency
Quote: My eyes are vague blue, like the sky, and change all the time; they are indiscriminate but fleeting, entirely specific and disloyal, so that no one trusts me. I am always looking away. Or again at something after it has given me up.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  Second April
Quote: EbbI know what my heart is likeSince your love died:It is like a hollow ledgeHolding a little poolLeft there by the tide,A little tepid pool,Drying inward from the edge.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Complete Stories and Poems
Quote: Take this kiss upon the brow!And, in parting from you now,Thus much let me avow-You are not wrong, who deemThat my days have been a dream;Yet if hope has flown awayIn a night, or in a day,In a vision, or in none,Is it therefore the less gone?All that we see or seemIs but a dream within a dream.

Author: William Carlos Williams,  Asphodel, That Greeny Flower and Other Love Poems: That Greeny Flower
Quote: It is difficultto get the news from poems yet men die miserably every day for lackof what is found there.

Author: Charlotte Eriksson
Quote: You read and write and sing and experience, thinking that one day these things will build the character you admire to live as. You love and lose and bleed best you can, to the extreme, hoping that one day the world will read you like the poem you want to be.

Author: Raymond Carver,  Ultramarine: Poems
Quote: there isn't enough of anythingas long as we live. But at intervalsa sweetness appears and, given a chanceprevails.

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
Quote: I remainMistress of mine own self and mine own soul

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: when I am feelinglowall i have to do iswatch my catsand mycouragereturns

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: It is beautiful to express love and even more beautiful to feel it.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: The most complicated skill is to be simple.

Author: Sara Teasdale
Quote: You will recognize your own path when you come upon it because you will suddenly have all the energy and imagination you will ever need.

Author: Amit Ray,  Yoga and Vipassana: An Integrated Life Style
Quote: Exercises are like prose, whereas yoga is the poetry of movements. Once you understand the grammar of yoga; you can write your poetry of movements.

Author: Jeffrey McDaniel
Quote: There's two kinds of women--those you write poems about and those you don't.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Poets are shameless with their experiences: they exploit them.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: Humanity i love you because youare perpetually putting the secret oflife in your pants and forgettingit's there and sitting downon itand because you areforever making poems in the lapof death Humanityi hate you

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: And in despair I bowed my head;"There is no peace on earth,"I said;"For hate is strong,And mocks the songOf peace on earth, good-will to men!"Then pealed the bells more loud and deep:"God is not dead, nor doth he sleep!The Wrong shall fail,the Right prevail,With peace on earth, good-will to men!

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: A wounded dear leaps the highest

Author: Andrea Gibson
Quote: Safety isn't always safe. You can find one on every gun.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.

Author: Dylan Thomas
Quote: Poetry is not the most important thing in life... I'd much rather lie in a hot bath reading Agatha Christie and sucking sweets.

Author: Rumi
Quote: You dance inside my chest,where no one sees you,but sometimes I do, and thatsight becomes this art.

Author: Morrissey
Quote: If you must write prose or poems, the words you use should be your own. Don't plagiarize or take 'on loan'. There's always someone, somewhere, with a big nose, who knows, who'll trip you up and laugh when you fall.

Author: Rumi
Quote: This poetry. I never know what I'm going to say.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
Quote: Sir, I admit your general rule, That every poet is a fool, But you yourself may serve to show it, That every fool is not a poet.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  In the Harbor
Quote: If you would hit the mark, you must aim a little above it;Every arrow that flies feels the attraction of earth.

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
Quote: If I say your voice is an amber waterfall in which I yearn to burn each day, if you eat my mouth like a mystical rose with powers of healing and damnation, If I confess that your body is the only civilization I long to experience… would it mean that we are close to knowing something about love?

Author: Christopher Brennan
Quote: Were knowledge all, what were our needTo thrill and faint and sweetly bleed?

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: in a worldfull oftemporary thingsyou area perpetual feeling.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Her happiness floated like waves of ocean along the coast of her life. She found lyrics of her life in his arms but she never sung her song.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Death is the easy part, the hard part is living and knowing you could be so much more then you’re willing to be.

Author: Adrienne Rich,  The Dream of a Common Language
Quote: No one has imagined us. We want to live like trees,sycamores blazing through the sulfuric air,dappled with scars, still exuberantly budding,our animal passion rooted in the city.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I'm hanging on to her memory like Spanish moss on an ancient Florida oak, and unlike the sunset, my love won't fade.

Author: Charlotte Eriksson
Quote: I haven’t been very impressed lately.By people,or places,or the way someone said he loved me and then slowly changed his mind.

Author: W.H. Auden
Quote: I will love you forever"swears the poet. I find this easy to swear too. "I will love you at 4:15 pm next Tuesday"- Is that still as easy?

Author: Robert Graves,  Poems 1965-1968
Quote: When the immense drugged universe explodesIn a cascade of unendurable colourAnd leaves us gasping naked,This is no more than the ectasy of chaos:Hold fast, with both hands, to that royal loveWhich alone, as we know certainly, restoresFragmentation into true being.Ecstasy of Chaos

Author: W.B. Yeats
Quote: Hope and Memory have one daughter and her name is Art, and she has built her dwelling far from the desperate field where men hang out their garments upon forked boughs to be banners of battle. O beloved daughter of Hope and Memory, be with me for a while.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: I don't want to go on being a root in the dark,vacillating, stretched out, shivering with sleep,downward, in the soaked guts of the earth,absorbing and thinking, eating each day.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.

Author: Czesław Miłosz
Quote: The purpose of poetry is to remind ushow difficult it is to remain just one person,for our house is open, there are no keys in the doors, and invisible guests come in and out at will.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: A tamed woman will never leave her mark in the world.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: I act as the tongue of you,... tied in your mouth . . . . in mine it begins to be loosened.

Author: John Milton,  The Complete Poetry
Quote: And so sepúlchred in such pomp dost lie,That kings for such a tomb would wish to die.

Author: Clementine von Radics
Quote: But my heart is an old house(the kind my mothergrew up in)hell to heat and cooland faulty in the wiringand though it’s nice to look atI have no businessinviting lovers in.

Author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko
Quote: A poet's autobiography is his poetry. Anything else is just a footnote.

Author: Sappho,  If Not, Winter: Fragments of Sappho
Quote: their heart grew coldthey let their wings down

Author: W.B. Yeats,  The Collected Poems of W.B. Yeats
Quote: When you are old and grey and full of sleep  And nodding by the fire, take down this book,  And slowly read, and dream of the soft look Your eyes had once, and of their shadows deep

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Hearts rebuilt from hope resurrect dreams killed by hate.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: As Unto the bow the the cord is ,So unto the man is woman;Though she bends him, she obeys him,Though she draws him , yet she follows:Useless each without the other.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: Fly without wings; Dream with open eyes; See in darkness.

Author: Adrienne Rich,  What is Found There: Notebooks on Poetry and Politics
Quote: [Poetry] is the liquid voice that can wear through stone.

Author: Roberto Bolaño,  The Savage Detectives
Quote: There is a time for reciting poems and a time for fists.

Author: Matsuo Bashō
Quote: This autumn-why am I growing old?bird disappearing among clouds.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: I really don't know what "I love you"means.I think it means "Don't leave me here alone.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: I love all things, not only the grand but the infinitely small: thimble, spurs, plates, flower vases.....

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: She who reconciles the ill-matched threadsOf her life, and weaves them gratefullyInto a single cloth – It’s she who drives the loudmouths from the hallAnd clears it for a different celebration.

Author: Octavio Paz,  The Collected Poems, 1957-1987
Quote: Beyond myself, somewhere, I wait for my arrival.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Songs for the Open Road: Poems of Travel and Adventure
Quote: Afoot and light-hearted I take to the open road.Healthy, free, the world before me.The long brown path before me leading me wherever I choose.Henceforth, I ask not good fortune, I myself am good fortune.Henceforth, I whimper no more, postpone no more, need nothing.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: There are only four times a year I love you: summer, fall, winter, and spring. I'll love you until the sun stops shining, until the clouds dissipate, when Mount Everest no longer has snow, and the flowers stop blooming.-Jarod Kintz and Karen Quan

Author: Mary Oliver,  Dream Work
Quote: I wanted the past to go away, I wanted to leave it, like another country; I wanted my life to close, and open like a hinge, like a wing, like the part of the song where it falls down over the rocks: an explosion, a discovery; I wanted to hurry into the work of my life; I wanted to know,whoever I was, I wasalive for a little while.

Author: Benny Bellamacina,  The King of Rhyme
Quote: If you wake up tired, you’ve been chasing dreams. If you go to bed tired, your making your dreams happen.

Author: Frank O'Hara
Quote: When I die, don't come, I wouldn't want a leafto turn away from the sun -- it loves it there.There's nothing so spiritual about being happybut you can't miss a day of it, because it doesn't last.

Author: Allen Ginsberg
Quote: I never dreamed the sea so deep,The earth so dark; so long my sleep,I have become another child.I wake to see the world go wild.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: A bank is a place where they lend you an umbrella in fair weather and ask for it back when it begins to rain.

Author: Stephen Dunn
Quote: I've triedto become someone else for a while,only to discover that he, too, was me.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Shape
Quote: I am the shore and the ocean, awaiting myself on both sides.

Author: Brian Jacques,  Lord Brocktree
Quote: So here is my story, may it bringSome smiles and a tear or so,It happened once upon a time,Far away, and long ago,Outside the night wind keens and wails,Come listen to me, the Teller of Tales!

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  In Memoriam
Quote: So runs my dream, but what am I?An infant crying in the nightAn infant crying for the lightAnd with no language but a cry.

Author: Audre Lorde
Quote: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  The Captain's Verses
Quote: You know how this is:if I lookat the crystal moon, at the red branchof the slow autumn at my window,if I touchnear the firethe impalpable ashor the wrinkled body of the log,everything carries me to you,as if everything that exists,aromas, light, metals,were little boatsthat sailtoward those isles of yours that wait for me.

Author: Gloria E. Anzaldúa
Quote: Though we tremble before uncertain futuresmay we meet illness, death and adversity with strengthmay we dance in the face of our fears.

Author: W.B. Yeats
Quote: I know that I shall meet my fate somewhere among the clouds above; those that I fight I do not hate, those that I guard I do not love.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: I know many lives worth living.

Author: John Milton,  The Complete Poetry
Quote: Such sweet compulsion doth in music lie.

Author: Shane Koyczan
Quote: Don't tell me you're not beautiful. You're the kind of beautiful the blind would see if we could figure out some way to give them three seconds of sight.

Author: Blaise Pascal,  Pensées
Quote: The last thing one discovers in composing a work is what to put first.

Author: Sara Teasdale,  Love Songs
Quote: I am not yours, not lost in you,Not lost, although I long to beLost as a candle lit at noon,Lost as a snowflake in the sea.You love me, and I find you stillA spirit beautiful and bright,Yet I am I, who long to beLost as a light is lost in light.

Author: Gaston Bachelard
Quote: To feel most beautifully alive means to be reading something beautiful, ready always to apprehend in the flow of language the sudden flash of poetry.

Author: James Jones,  The Thin Red Line
Quote: If I never meet you In this lifeLet me feel the lackA glance from your eyesThen my life Will be yours

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: This is thy hour O Soul, thy free flight into the wordless, Away from books, away from art, the day erased, the lesson done,Thee fully forth emerging, silent, gazing, pondering the themes thou lovest best. Night, sleep, and the stars.

Author: Saul Williams
Quote: They say that I am a poetI wonder what they would say if they saw me from the inside I bottleemotions and place them into the sea for others to unbottle ondistant shores I am unsure as to whether they ever reach and forthat matter as to whether I ever get my point acrossor my love

Author: Jeffrey McDaniel
Quote: But one kiss levitates above all the others. Theintersection of function and desire. The I do kiss.The I’ll love you through a brick wall kiss.Even when I’m dead, I’ll swim through the Earth,like a mermaid of the soil, just to be next to your bones.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Ah, when to the heart of man Was it ever less than a treason To go with the drift of things, To yield with a grace to reason, And bow and accept the end Of a love or a season?

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: the saddest thing is to bea minute to someone,when you've made them your eternity.

Author: John Keats
Quote: If poetry comes not as naturally as the leaves to a tree it had better not come at all.

Author: Alexander Pope,  The Rape of the Lock
Quote: Beauties in vain their pretty eyes may roll; Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My writing has appeared in the New Yorker and The Atlantic Monthly, though whenever the newsstand guy catches me scribbling my poetry in them, he always comes along later and erases it.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Flowers are aromatic and romantic, and they grow exactly the way love does—with plenty of light, and watered with affection.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My love has a flow like a flower, so it’s best if you water it with the fragrance of romance, which has the aroma of loyalty.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The heart pumps blood, a fluid, but it also pulses love, which is as liquid as a wave, and everyone wants a refill. My goal is to be a server.

Author: William Carlos Williams,  Paterson
Quote: You lethargic, waiting upon me,waiting for the fire and Iattendant upon you, shaken by your beautyShaken by your beauty Shaken.

Author: Seamus Heaney,  Beowulf
