Quote: It is always betterto avenge dear ones than to indulge in mourning.For every one of us, living in this worldmeans waiting for our end. Let whoever canwin glory before death. When a warrior is gone,that will be his best and only bulwark.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: We had a lavender kind of love, so soothing and smooth, and if I could bottle up what we had, you'd want it all over your body.

Author: Dylan Thomas
Quote: [I'm]a freak user of words, not a poet.

Author: Nikki Giovanni
Quote: and sometimes I sitdown at my typewriterand I thinknot of someonecause there isn't anyoneto thinkabout and i wonderis it worth it

Author: Violet Yates,  Lost & Found
Quote: I am a work in progress.

Author: Alexander Pope,  An Essay on Man
Quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast; Man never Is, but always To be blest. The soul, uneasy, and confin'd from home, Rests and expatiates in a life to come.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
Quote: No one but Night, with tears on her dark face, watches beside me in this windy place.

Author: John Donne,  The Complete English Poems
Quote: Licence my roving hands, and let them go Before, behind, between, above, below.

Author: Jim Carroll,  Fear of Dreaming: The Selected Poems
Quote: I'll Die For Your Sins If You Live For mine.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Waste Land and Other Poems
Quote: Who is the third who walks always beside you?When I count, there are only you and I togetherBut when I look ahead up the white roadThere is always another one walking beside youGliding wrapt in a brown mantle, hoodedI do not know whether a man or a woman-But who is that on the other side of you?

Author: Matsuo Bashō
Quote: Real poetry, is to lead a beautiful life. To live poetry is better than to write it.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: I could be in the middle of a spiritual hurricane, my soul torn and tormented, but when I see you smile it's blue skies for miles. You give me a tsunami of emotions, and my heart is trying to find peace through crashing waves, but they always end up in a cyclone that never dies.-Jarod Kintz and Karen Quan

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring
Quote: The world was fair, the mountains tallIn Elder Days before the fall...

Author: Sherman Alexie,  The Business of Fancydancing
Quote: Everyone I have lost in the closing of a doorthe click of the lockis not forgotten, theydo not die but remainwithin the soft edgesof the earth, the ashof house fires and cancerin sin and forgivenesshuddled under old blanketsdreaming their way intomy hands, my heartclosing tight like fists.- "Indian Boy Love Song #1

Author: Carl Sandburg
Quote: Poetry is an echo asking a shadow to dance.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Our birth is but a sleep and a forgetting:The Soul that rises with us, our life's Star,Hath had elsewhere its setting,And cometh from afar:Not in entire forgetfulness,And not in utter nakedness,But trailing clouds of glory do we come

Author: Colleen Hoover,  Maybe Someday
Quote: Truths are written, never said... Lines are drawn, but then they fade.

Author: Lang Leav,  Love & Misadventure
Quote: I don't think all writers are sad, she said.I think it's the other way around—all sad people write.

Author: George Eliot,  Middlemarch
Quote: To be a poet is to have a soul so quick to discern, that no shade of quality escapes it, and so quick to feel, that discernment is but a hand playing with finely-ordered variety on the chords of emotion--a soul in which knowledge passes instantaneously into feeling, and feeling flashes back as a new organ of knowledge.

Author: Adrienne Rich,  Twenty One Love Poems
Quote: I touch you knowing we weren't born tomorrow,and somehow, each of us will help the other live,and somewhere, each of us must help the other die.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Letters and Social Aims
Quote: Some people will tell you there is a great deal of poetry and fine sentiment in a chest of tea.

Author: Richard Siken,  Crush
Quote: We pull our boots on with both handsbut we can't punch ourselves awake and all I can do is stand on the curb and say Sorryabout the blood in your mouth. I wish it was mine.I couldn't get the boy to kill me, but I wore his jacket for the longest time.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The heart sees what the eyes do not, and the heart hears what the ears cannot. Sight and sound are vibrations, and so is love.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: He ate and drank the precious words,His spirit grew robust;He knew no more that he was poor,Nor that his frame was dust.He danced along the dingy days,And this bequest of wingsWas but a book. What libertyA loosened spirit brings!

Author: Denise Levertov
Quote: In the dark I rest,unready for the light which dawnsday after day,eager to be shared.Black silk, shelter me.I needmore of the night before I openeyes and heartto illumination. I must stillgrow in the dark like a rootnot ready, not ready at all.

Author: Charles Wright,  Littlefoot: A Poem
Quote: What makes us leave what we love best?What is it inside us that keeps erasing itselfWhen we need it most,That sends us into uncertainty for its own sakeAnd holds us flush there until we begin to love itAnd have to begin again?What is it within our own lives we decline to liveWhenever we find it, making our days unendurable,And nights almost visionless?I still don't know yet, but I do it.

Author: Christina Rossetti
Quote: What are heavy? sea-sand and sorrow.What are brief? today and tomorrow.What are frail? spring blossoms and youth.What are deep? the ocean and truth.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: There are two ways to dislike poetry: One is to dislike it; the other is to read Pope.

Author: Rumi
Quote: My friend, you thought you lost Him;that all your life you've been separated from Him.Filled with wonder, you've always looked outside for Him,and haven't searched within your own house.

Author: George Gordon Byron,  Childe Harold's Pilgrimage
Quote: I live not in myself, but I becomePortion of that around me: and to meHigh mountains are a feeling, but the humof human cities torture.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I find Bukowski to be so edgy, gritty, and daring that he oozes romance, and if couples read him in bed they would appreciate what they have.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Poetry is a way of taking life by the throat.

Author: Nâzım Hikmet
Quote: … and the most beautiful words ever spoken, I have not yet said to you.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: I like the posture, but not the yoga. I like the inebriated morning, but not the opium. I like the flower but not the garden, the moment but not the dream. Quiet, my love. Be still. I am sleeping.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: For the moon never beams without bringing me dreams Of the beautiful Annabel Lee; And the stars never rise but I feel the bright eyes Of the beautiful Annabel Lee; And so, all the night-tide, I lie down by the side Of my darling- my darling- my life and my bride, In the sepulchre there by the sea, In her tomb by the sounding sea.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: All bad poetry springs from genuine feeling. To be natural is to be obvious, and to be obvious is to be inartistic.

Author: Wallace Stevens,  The Collected Poems
Quote: The only emperor is the emperor of ice cream.

Author: Yosa Buson
Quote: Calligraphy of geeseagainst the sky-the moon seals it.

Author: Philip Larkin
Quote: So many things I had thought forgottenReturn to my mind with stranger pain:Like letters that arrive addressed to someoneWho left the house so many years ago.

Author: Peter S. Beagle,  The Last Unicorn
Quote: Sparrows and cats will live in my shoe,Sooner than I will live with you.Fish will come walking out of the sea,Sooner than you will come back to me.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: And I learned what is obvious to a child. That life is simply a collection of little lives, each lived one day at a time. That each day should be spent finding beauty in flowers and poetry and talking to animals. That a day spent with dreaming and sunsets and refreshing breezes cannot be bettered.

Author: Mary Oliver,  Why I Wake Early
Quote: The Old Poets Of ChinaWherever I am, the world comes after me.It offers me its busyness. It does not believethat I do not want it. Now I understandwhy the old poets of China went so far and highinto the mountains, then crept into the pale mist.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: Such was a poet and shall be and is-who'll solve the depths of horror to defend a sunbeam's architecture with his life: and carve immortal jungles of despair to hold a mountain's heartbeat in his hand.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  Ariel
Quote: I am inhabited by a cry. Nightly it flaps outLooking, with its hooks, for something to love.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: When she was a child, my love carried a road-map in her hand the way other girls carried handkerchiefs. She always knew the way. Her feet were little wings. And her beautiful head was a compass.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: In the final analysis it is between you and God, it was never between you and them anyway.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  Ariel
Quote: The blood jet is poetryThere is no stopping it.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Dreams, books, are each a world; and books, we know,Are a substantial world, both pure and good:Round these, with tendrils strong as flesh and blood,Our pastime and our happiness will grow.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: To fall in love with someone's thoughts - the most intimate, splendid romance.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: The best kind of humans are the ones who stay.

Author: Allen Ginsberg
Quote: Poets are damned… but see with the eyes of angels.

Author: Morrissey
Quote: Sing your life; any fool can think of words that rhyme.

Author: Langston Hughes,  Selected Poems
Quote: Out of love,No regrets--Though the goodnessBe wasted forever.Out of love,No regrets--Though the returnBe never.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  100 Love Sonnets
Quote: Love is a clash of lightnings

Author: Anna Akhmatova,  Poems of Akhmatova
Quote: As the future ripens in the past,so the past rots in the future --a terrible festival of dead leaves.

Author: Terry Lander,  Life Through the Eyes of an Insider: 101 Poems to Help You Understand Life Better
Quote: I’m not aspiring to be someone else – If I’m me for the rest of my life then so be it

Author: Heinrich Heine
Quote: Perfumes are the feelings of flowers.

Author: John Berryman
Quote: You should always be trying to write a poem you are unable to write, a poem you lack the technique, the language, the courage to achieve. Otherwise you're merely imitating yourself, going nowhere, because that's always easiest.

Author: Richard Siken,  Crush
Quote: You're trying not to tell him you love him, and you're trying to choke down the feeling, and you're trembling, but he reaches over and he touches you, like a prayer for which no words exist, and you feel your heart taking root in your body, like you've discovered something you don't even have a name for.

Author: John Berger,  And Our Faces, My Heart, Brief as Photos
Quote: My heart born nakedwas swaddled in lullabies.Later alone it worepoems for clothes.Like a shirtI carried on my backthe poetry I had read.So I lived for half a centuryuntil wordlessly we met.From my shirt on the back of the chairI learn tonighthow many yearsof learning by heartI waited for you.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: We were hooked when we woke.We had arms for each other.But I yearned to resumeMy dreams of another.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Sometimes the most beautiful people are beautifully broken.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: We swallowed the chaos because we knew we didn't want to be ordinary.

Author: Richard Siken
Quote: He could build a city. Has a certain capacity. There’s a niche in his chestwhere a heart would fit perfectlyand he thinks if he could just maneuver one into place –well then, game over.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: Much Madness Is Divinest SenseMuch Madness is divinest Sense —To a discerning Eye —Much Sense — the starkest Madness —'Tis the MajorityIn this, as All, prevail —Assent — and you are sane —Demur — you're straightway dangerous —And handled with a Chain —

Author: Octavio Paz,  Sunstone/Piedra De Sol
Quote: because two bodies, naked and entwined,leap over time, they are invulnerable,nothing can touch them, they return to the source,there is no you, no I, no tomorrow,no yesterday, no names, the truth of twoin a single body, a single soul,oh total being...

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: So I find words I never thought to speakIn streets I never thought I should revisitWhen I left my body on a distant shore.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: My heart leaps up when I beholdA rainbow in the sky:So was it when my life began;So is it now I am a man;

Author: George Eliot,  The Mill on the Floss
Quote: Poetry and art and knowledge are sacred and pure.

Author: W.H. Auden,  As I Walked Out One Evening: Songs, Ballads, Lullabies, Limericks & Other Light Verse
Quote: O stand, stand at the window As the tears scald and start;You shall love your crooked neighbour With your crooked heart.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I sip my coffee like I fall in love—alone in a field of flowers, writing poetry for the mailman, who delivers love letters, but never gets any.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense
Quote: having nothing to struggleagainstthey have nothing to strugglefor.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: But dear, don’t be afraid of love it’s only magic.

Author: Saul Williams,  She
Quote: she stuck a bookmark in my heart and walked away

Author: Saul Williams
Quote: The wind is the moon's imagination wandering.

Author: G.K. Chesterton,  Fancies Versus Fads
Quote: ..."vers libre,"(free verse) or nine-tenths of it, is not a new metre any more than sleeping in a ditch is a new school of architecture.

Author: Arthur Rimbaud,  Complete Works
Quote: I have stretched ropes from steeple to steeple; Garlands from window to window; Golden chains from star to star ... And I dance.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Blood was its Avatar and its seal.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: This Valentine’s Day rent a poem for your loved. They come in three sizes—small, medium, and romantic. Free refills available to Premium Members.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The wind is my favorite color. It reminds me of the love she painted on my life as she blew past me.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: I grew up in this town, my poetry was born between the hill and the river, it took its voice from the rain, and like the timber, it steeped itself in the forests.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  Ariel
Quote: Is it the sea you hear in me,Its dissatisfactions?Or the voice of nothing, that was you madness?

Author: Ryokan
Quote: Too lazy to be ambitious,I let the world take care of itself.Ten days' worth of rice in my bag;a bundle of twigs by the fireplace.Why chatter about delusion and enlightenment?Listening to the night rain on my roof,I sit comfortably, with both legs stretched out.

Author: Charles Sedley
Quote: No drowning man can know which dropOf water his last breath did stop

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: There's a certain slant of light,On winter afternoons,That oppresses, like the weightOf cathedral tunes.

Author: John Milton,  The Complete Poetry
Quote: Where the bright seraphim in burning rowTheir loud uplifted angel trumpets blow.

Author: Carl Sandburg
Quote: Gather the stars if you wish it soGather the songs and keep them.Gather the faces of women.Gather for keeping years and years.And then...Loosen your hands, let go and say good-bye.Let the stars and songs go.Let the faces and years go.Loosen your hands and say good-bye.

Author: Robert Browning
Quote: Take away love and our earth is a tomb.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: When from our better selves we have too longBeen parted by the hurrying world, and droop,Sick of its business, of its pleasures tired,How gracious, how benign, is Solitude

Author: L.M. Elliott,  Annie, Between the States
Quote: Poetry, plays, novels, music, they are the cry of the human spirit trying to understand itself and make sense of our world.

Author: Leonard Cohen,  The Favorite Game
Quote: Deprivation is the mother of poetry.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  Plath: Poems
Quote: O love, how did you get here?--Nick and the Candlestick

Author: Harold Pinter
Quote: I know the placeI know the place.It is true.Everything we doCorrects the spaceBetween death and meAnd you.

Author: Francis William Bourdillon
Quote: The night has a thousand eyes,And the day but one; Yet the light of the bright world dies With the dying sun. The mind has a thousand eyes, And the heart but one: Yet the light of a whole life dies When love is done.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Poetry is finer and more philosophical than history; for poetry expresses the universal, and history only the particular.

Author: Vladimir Mayakovsky,  Listen!
Quote: Listen! If stars are litIt means there is someone who needs it,It means someone wants them to be,That someone deems those specks of spitMagnificent!

Author: Robert Frost,  The Poetry of Robert Frost
Quote: I would not come in.I meant not even if asked,And I hadn't been.

Author: Saul Williams
Quote: We are unraveling our navels so that we may ingest the sun. We are not afraid of the darkness. We trust that the moon shall guide us. We are determining the future at this very moment. We know that the heart is the philosopher's stone. Our music is our alchemy.

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: There is nothing at all that can be talked about adequately, and the whole art of poetry is to say what can't be said.

Author: Jane Kenyon
Quote: The poet's job is to put into words those feelings we all have that are so deep, so important, and yet so difficult to name, to tell the truth in such a beautiful way, that people cannot live without it.

Author: Tanzy Sayadi,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: The aching in my chest isn't because I miss you,it's realizing that you have become someone I no longer know,your fears, your 4 am thoughts, your achievements,are things I no longer have an equivalent to.Who we were and who we are are four different people, and the me from now doesn't relate to the me from then, let alone to the you from now.-Tanzy Sayadi and Jarod Kintz

Author: Adrienne Rich,  Diving Into the Wreck
Quote: ...you look at me like an emergency

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: The sunset produces flower clouds in a garden in the sky, and while there is still light you can see a heavenly representation of my love for you.The sunrise produces rays that light up the world like your eyes do when you're with me. They shimmer and I can see the stars in your eyes that gleam from your soul.-Jarod Kintz and Karen Quan

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: I remember being surrounded by the heaven-sent scent of July pine in the Rockies, as you and I laughed and danced like the snow would never come. Now, as the snow covers everything, just like I in these sheets, I close my eyes, preparing myself to see you again, my summer queen.-Jarod Kintz and Tanzy Sayadi

Author: Bruce Wayne Sullivan
Quote: Anyone who has no need of anybody but himself is either a beast or a God."Aristotle

Author: Ezra Pound
Quote: Rhythm must have meaning.

Author: Javan,  Something to Someone
Quote: I don't wish to be everything to everyone, but I would like to be something to someone.

Author: Billy Collins,  Sailing Alone Around the Room: New and Selected Poems
Quote: But some nights, I must tell you,I go down there after everyone has fallen asleep.I swim back and forth in the echoing blackness.I sing a love song as well as I can,lost for a while in the home of the rain.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: a flower knows, when its butterfly will return, and if the moon walks out, the sky will understand;but now it hurts, to watch you leave so soon,when I don't know, if you will ever come back.

Author: Kim Addonizio
Quote: . . . All artists’ work is autobiographical. Any writer’s work is a map of their psyche. You can really see what their concerns are, what their obsessions are, and what interests them.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  Crossing the Water
Quote: Stars open among the lilies.Are you not blinded by such expressionless sirens?This is the silence of astounded souls.

Author: John Milton,  Paradise Lost
Quote: Our state cannot be severed, we are one,One flesh; to lose thee were to lose myself.

Author: William Blake,  Auguries of Innocence
Quote: To see a World in a grain of sand,And a Heaven in a wild flower,Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand,And Eternity in an hour.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Waste Land and Other Writings
Quote: You gave me hyacinths first a year ago; They called me the hyacinth girl.' —Yet when we came back, late, from the Hyacinth garden, Your arms full, and your hair wet, I could not Speak, and my eyes failed, I was neither Living nor dead, and I knew nothing, Looking into the heart of light, the silence. Od' und leer das Meer.

Author: Rudyard Kipling
Quote: At two o'clock in the morning, if you open your window and listen,You will hear the feet of the Wind that is going to call the sun.And the trees in the Shadow rustle and the trees in the moonlight glisten,And though it is deep, dark night, you feel that the night is done.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: Like poetry, fashion does not state anything. It merely suggests

Author: Li-Young Lee
Quote: We suffer each other to have each other a while.

Author: Carl Sandburg
Quote: Poetry is the synthesis of hyacinths and biscuits.

Author: Mary Oliver,  Red Bird
Quote: So come to the pond, or the river of your imagination, or the harbor of your longing,and put your lips to the world.And live your life.

Author: Jorge Luis Borges,  This Craft of Verse
Quote: Sometimes, looking at the many books I have at home, I feel I shall die before I come to the end of them, yet I cannot resist the temptation of buying new books. Whenever I walk into a bookstore and find a book on one of my hobbies — for example, Old English or Old Norse poetry — I say to myself, “What a pity I can’t buy that book, for I already have a copy at home.

Author: Nora Roberts,  Born in Fire
Quote: He wanted to be a poet,' someone else put in while Maggie hugged Tim and patted his back. 'Said he'd only lacked the words to be one.

Author: Rubén Darío
Quote: You are an Universe of Universes and your soul a source of songs.

Author: Daphne Gottlieb,  Why Things Burn
Quote: come back so i can say yes this time do it again now that i know what to call what you didthis time i'll be ready i like it rough now and i'm done with romance i never met another man who loved me so much at first sight he had to hurt me to do it

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: Because philosophy arises from awe, a philosopher is bound in his way to be a lover of myths and poetic fables. Poets and philosophers are alike in being big with wonder.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts;And when you can no longer dwell in the solitude of your heart you live in your lips, and sound is a diversion and a pastime.And in much of your talking, thinking is half murdered.

Author: H.D.,  Trilogy: The Walls Do Not Fall / Tribute to the Angels / The Flowering of the Rod
Quote: ...if you do not even understand what words say,how can you expect to pass judgementon what words conceal?

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Rime of the Ancient Mariner
Quote: Since then, at an uncertain hour, That agony returns: And till my ghastly tale is told, This heart within me burns.

Author: Rosa Luxemburg
Quote: Being human means throwing your whole life on the scales of destiny when need be, all the while rejoicing in every sunny day and every beautiful cloud.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: It’s funny, for all it took was a broken heart and that alone was enough, enough for her to do everything she ever dreamed of.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Waste Land
Quote: My nerves are bad to-night. Yes, bad. Stay with me. 'Speak to me. Why do you never speak? Speak. 'What are you thinking of? What thinking? What? 'I never know what you are thinking. Think.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Annabel Lee
Quote: For the moon never beams without bringing me dreamsOf the beautiful Annabel Lee;And the stars never rise but i feel the bright eyesOf the beautiful Annabel Lee.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  The Waves
Quote: Now begins to rise in me the familiar rhythm; words that have lain dormant now lift, now toss their crests, and fall and rise, and falls again. I am a poet, yes. Surely I am a great poet.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  Collected Poems
Quote: Stranger, pause and look;From the dust of agesLift this little book,Turn the tattered pages,Read me, do not let me die!Search the fading letters findingSteadfast in the broken bindingAll that once was I!

Author: Robert Burns
Quote: Some hae meat and canna eat,And some wad eat that want it,But we hae meat and we can eat,And sae the Lord be thankit.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Quote: A poet who reads his verse in public may have other nasty habits.

Author: Frank O'Hara
Quote: I can't even enjoy a blade of grass unless I know there's a subway handy, or a record store or some other sign that people do not totally regret life. It's more important to confirm the least sincere. The clouds get enough attention as it is...

Author: Lao Tzu,  The Chinese Translations
Quote: A man who knows how little he knows is well, a man who knows how much he knows is sick. If, when you see the symptoms, you can tell, Your cure is quick.A sound man knows that sickness makes him sick and before he catches it his cure is quick.

Author: Numey
Quote: A lot we have in our head,But things of heart are not yet dead,They have done none, but just fled,Out of us, Forgotten, just been bled..

Author: George Gordon Byron,  Poetical Works
Quote: We'll Go No More A-rovingSo, we'll go no more a-rovingSo late into the night,Though the heart still be as loving,And the moon still be as bright.For the sword outwears its sheath,And the soul wears out the breast,And the heart must pause to breathe,And love itself have rest.Though the night was made for loving,And the day returns too soon,Yet we'll go no more a-rovingBy the light of the moon.

Author: Theodore Roethke,  The Collected Poems
Quote: By daily dying, I have come to be.

Author: Plato
Quote: Poetry is nearer to vital truth than history.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I fall in love with you four times a year: winter, spring, summer, and fall. The leaves may change, but how I feel about you does not.

Author: Omar Khayyám
Quote: This worldthat was our homefor a brief spellnever brought us anythingbut pain and grief;its a shame that not one of our problemswas ever solved.We departwith a thousand regretsin our hearts.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Complete Poems
Quote: In Xanadu did Kubla KhanA stately pleasure-dome decree:Where Alph, the sacred river, ranThrough caverns measureless to man Down to a sunless sea.

Author: Frank O'Hara
Quote: Kerouac: You're ruining American poetry, O'Hara.O'Hara: That's more than you ever did for it, Kerouac

Author: William Blake
Quote: A Robin Redbreast in a CagePuts all Heaven in a Rage.A dove house fill’d with doves and pigeonsShudders Hell thro’ all its regions.A Dog starv’d at his Master’s GatePredicts the ruin of the State.A Horse misus’d upon the RoadCalls to Heaven for Human blood.Each outcry of the hunted HareA fiber from the Brain does tear.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: By a route obscure and lonelyHaunted by ill angels only,Where an eidolon, named NIGHT,On a black throne reigns upright,I have reached these lands but newlyFrom an ultimate dim Thule --From a wild, weird clime that lieth, sublime,Out of SPACE, out of TIME.

Author: William Carlos Williams,  Spring and All
Quote: It is at the edge of the petal that love waits

Author: William Carlos Williams,  The Farmers' Daughters
Quote: Your thighs are appletrees. Your knees are a southern breeze.

Author: Lucy Grealy
Quote: Does something which exists on the edge have no true relevance to the stable center, or does it, by being on the edge, become a part of the edge and thus a part of the boundary, the definition which gives the whole its shape?

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: I think there is a song out there to describe just about any situation.

Author: Federico García Lorca,  Three Tragedies: Blood Wedding, Yerma, Bernarda Alba
Quote: My head is full of fireand grief and my tongueruns wild, piercedwith shards of glass.

Author: Cath Crowley,  Graffiti Moon
Quote: If my like for you was a football crowd, you’d be deaf ’cause of the roar. And if my like for you was a boxer, there’d be a dead guy lying on the floor. And if my like for you was sugar, you’d lose your teeth before you were twenty. And if my like for you was money, let’s just say you’d be spending plenty.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: The flower bloomed and faded. The sun rose and sank. The lover loved and went. And what the poets said in rhyme, the young translated into practice.

Author: Jean Cocteau
Quote: The poet doesn't invent. He listens.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Even when muddy your wings sparkle bright wonders that heal broken worlds.

Author: W.H. Auden,  Another Time
Quote: Follow, poet, follow rightTo the bottom of the night,With your unconstraining voiceStill persuade us to rejoice;With the farming of a verseMake a vineyard of the curse,Sing of human unsuccessIn a rapture of distress;In the deserts of the heartLet the healing fountain start,In the prison of his daysTeach the free man how to praise.

Author: Omar Khayyám,  Edward Fitzgerald's The Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam
Quote: A book of verses underneath the boughA flask of wine, a loaf of bread and thouBeside me singing in the wildernessAnd wilderness is paradise now.

Author: Kate DiCamillo,  Flora and Ulysses: The Illuminated Adventures
Quote: Nothingwould beeasier withoutyou,because youare everything,all of it-sprinkles, quarks, giantdonuts, eggs sunny-side up-youare the ever-expandinguniverseto me.

Author: Karen Joy Fowler,  The Jane Austen Book Club
Quote: I once broke up with a boy because he wrote me an awful poem.

Author: James Kavanaugh,  There Are Men Too Gentle to Live Among Wolves
Quote: I saw my face todayAnd it looked older,Without the warmth of wisdomOr the softnessBorn of pain and waiting.The dreams were gone from my eyes,Hope lost in hollownessOn my cheeks,A finger of deathPulling at my jaws.So I did my push-upsAnd wondered if I'd ever find you,To see my faceWith friendlier eyes than mine.

Author: Frank O'Hara,  The Collected Poems of Frank O'Hara
Quote: I am ashamed of my century, but I have to smile.

Author: Christopher Marlowe,  The Complete Plays and Poems
Quote: Come live with me and be my Love, And we will all the pleasures prove

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: If you only write when inspired, you may be a fairly decent poet, but you'll never be a novelist.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense
Quote: the worst thing,"he told me,"is bitterness, people end up sobitter.

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
Quote: I arise from dreams of thee,And a spirit in my feetHas led me- who knows how?To thy chamber-window, Sweet!

Author: Tim Burton
Quote: Staring GirlI once knew a girlwho would just stand there and stare.At anyone or anything,she seemed not to careShe'd stare at the ground,She'd stare at the sky.She'd stare at you for hours,and you'd never know why.But after winning the local staring contest,she finally gave her eyesa well-deserved rest.

Author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti,  The House of Life
Quote: Look in my face; my name is Might-have-been; I am also call'd No-more, Too-late, Farewell

Author: Michelangelo Buonarroti
Quote: If I am more alive because love burns and chars me,as a fire, given wood or wind, feels new elation,it's that he who lays me low is my salvation,and invigorates the more, the more he scars me.

Author: Wallace Stevens
Quote: We live in an old chaos of the sun.

Author: John Keats,  Bright Star: Love Letters and Poems of John Keats to Fanny Brawne
Quote: You are always new. THe last of your kisses was ever the sweetest; the last smile the brightest; the last movement the gracefullest. When you pass'd my window home yesterday, I was fill'd with as much admiration as if I had then seen you for the first time...Even if you did not love me I could not help an entire devotion to you.

Author: Matthew Arnold,  Matthew Arnold: The Complete Poems
Quote: But often, in the world’s most crowded streets,But often, in the din of strife,There rises an unspeakable desireAfter the knowledge of our buried life;A thirst to spend our fire and restless forceIn tracking out our true, original course;A longing to inquireInto the mystery of this heart which beatsSo wild, so deep in us—to knowWhence our lives come and where they go.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Rilke's Book of Hours: Love Poems to God
Quote: I want my own will, and I wantsimply to be with my will,as it goes toward action.And in the silent, sometimes hardly moving times,when something is coming near,I want to be with those who knowsecret things or else alone...I want to unfold.I don’t want to be folded anywhere,because where I am folded,there I am a lie.

Author: Adrian C. Louis,  Fire Water World: Poems
Quote: I'm at that place I grew up to leave.

Author: José Luís Peixoto,  A Criança em Ruínas
Quote: one day, when tenderness has become the single rule of the morning,/ I will wake in your arms. perhaps your skin will be overly gorgeous./ and the light will include the impossible understanding of love.

Author: Lang Leav,  Love & Misadventure
Quote: She lends her pen,to thoughts of him,that flow from it,in her solitary.For she is his poet,And he is her poetry.

Author: Alexander Pope
Quote: To wake the soul by tender strokes of art,To raise the genius, and to mend the heart

Author: Richard Brautigan,  Rommel Drives on Deep Into Egypt
Quote: Hinged to forgetfulness like a door,she slowly closed out of sight,and she was the woman I loved,but too many times she slept likea mechanical deer in my caresses,and I ached in the metal silenceof her dreams.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Princess
Quote: Oh, what is brighter than the light?What is darker than the night?What is keener than an axe?What is softer than melting wax?Truth is brighter than the light,Falsehood darker than the night.Revenge is keener than an axe,And love is softer than melting wax.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I'm sober. Yessiree, I quit drinking. I haven't had a beer in four hours. Now I just need some coffee and to get drunk on love poetry.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson,  Selected Poems
Quote: REQUIEMUnder the wide and starry skyDig the grave and let me lie:Glad did I live and gladly die,And I laid me down with a will.This be the verse you grave for me:Here he lies where he long'd to be;Home is the sailor, home from the sea,And the hunter home from the hill.

Author: Pablo Neruda,  Twenty Love Poems and a Song of Despair
Quote: Ya no la quiero, es cierto, pero tal vez la quiero.Es tan corto el amor, y es tan largo el olvido.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Poetic Principle
Quote: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of beauty.

Author: Chairil Anwar
Quote: sekali berarti sesudah itu mati

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The wind may be invisible, but it’s colored by memories of you, as you gently blew into my life, adding motion and emotion to my still-beating heart.

Author: John Donne,  The Complete English Poems
Quote: My face in thine eye, thine in mine appeares, And true plaine hearts doe in the faces rest, Where can we finde two better hemispheares Without sharpe North, without declining West? What ever dyes, was not mixt equally; If our two loves be one, or, thou and I Love so alike, that none doe slacken, none can die.

Author: Jack Gilbert,  The Dance Most of All: Poems
Quote: Waking At NightThe blue river is grey at morningand evening. There is twilightat dawn and dusk. I lie in the darkwondering if this quiet in me nowis a beginning or an end.

Author: Horace
Quote: Happy the man, and happy he alone,he who can call today his own:he who, secure within, can say,Tomorrow do thy worst, for I have lived today.Be fair or foul, or rain or shinethe joys I have possessed, in spite of fate, are mine.Not Heaven itself, upon the past has power,but what has been, has been, and I have had my hour.

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley,  The Complete Poems
Quote: Music, When Soft Voices DieMusic, when soft voices die, Vibrates in the memory; Odours, when sweet violets sicken, Live within the sense they quicken. Rose leaves, when the rose is dead, Are heap'd for the belovèd's bed; And so thy thoughts, when thou art gone, Love itself shall slumber on.

Author: Saul Williams
Quote: Books are carefully folded forests/void of autumn/bound from the sun

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A white wedding dress, once worn, is like the ghost of a moment, trapping feelings of forever into fabric that’s never to be tried on again.

Author: William Wordsworth,  Lines Composed a Few Miles Above Tintern Abbey
Quote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth; but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.

Author: Beau Taplin
Quote: Self love is an oceanand your heart is a vessel. Make it full,and any excess will spill overinto the lives of the peopleyou hold dear. But you must come first.

Author: Charles Dickens,  The Pickwick Papers
Quote: Poetry makes life what lights and music do the stage.

Author: Jay-Z,  Decoded
Quote: A poet's mission is to make words do more work than they normally do, to make them work on more than one level.

Author: Billy Collins,  Sailing Alone Around the Room: New and Selected Poems
Quote: I see all of us reading ourselves away from ourselves,  straining in circles of light to find more light until the line of words becomes a trail of crumbs that we follow across a page of fresh snow

Author: Harryette Mullen
Quote: I regret to say I'munable to reply to your unexpressed desires.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: Quiero hacer contigo lo que la primavera hace con los cerezos

Author: Adrienne Rich,  The Dream of a Common Language
Quote: I choose to love this time for oncewith all my intelligence-from "Splittings

Author: Julio Cortázar,  Around the Day in Eighty Worlds
Quote: Wordplay hides a key to reality that the dictionary tries in vain to lock inside every free word.

Author: Kami Garcia,  Beautiful Creatures
Quote: Nobody the dead man & Nobody the livingNobody is giving in & Nobody is givingNobody hears me but just Nobody caresNobody fears me but Nobody just staresNobody belongs to me & Nobody remainsNo Nobody knows nothingAll that remains are remains

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: I had to learn to live without you and I couldn't make sense of it, because I left so much of me inside of you.

Author: Gustave Flaubert,  Flaubert in Egypt: A Sensibility on Tour
Quote: What wretched poverty of language! To compare stars to diamonds!

Author: Gwendolyn Brooks
Quote: Poetry is life distilled.

Author: Kristi Maxwell
Quote: Living together/ is one move closer/ to living apart

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: Cheap little rhymesA cheap little tuneAre sometimes as dangerousAs a sliver of the moon.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: i want to be in love with youthe same wayi am in love with the moonwith the lightshiningout of its soul.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: The wind may be invisible, but it’s colored by memories of you, as you gently blew into my life, adding motion and emotion to my still-beating heart. I feel you here with me, even though I'm all alone. Time is only measured now by then seconds since you've gone, and losing you is as painful as running a faucet on a bloody wound.-Jarod Kintz and Crystal Woods

Author: Amy Lowell
Quote: I am tired, Beloved, of chafing my heart againstThe want of you;Of squeezing it into little inkdrops,And posting it.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore,  Lover's Gift
Quote: The young student sits with his head bent over his books, and his mind straying in youth's dreamland; where prose is prowling on the desk and poetry hiding in the heart.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: I felt a Cleaving in my Mind—As if my Brain had split—I tried to match it—Seam by Seam—But could not make it fit.

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
Quote: I feel there is an angel in me' she'd say 'whom I amconstantly shocking

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: If I lived a million lives, I would've felt a million feelings and I still would've fallen a million times for you.

Author: Stephen Dunn,  Different Hours
Quote: I'll say I love you,Which will lead, of course,to disappointment,but those words unsaidpoison every next moment.I will try to disappoint youbetter than anyone else has.

Author: Dorothy Parker,  The Portable Dorothy Parker
Quote: My love runs by like a day in June, And he makes no friends of sorrows. He'll tread his galloping rigadoon In the pathway of the morrows. He'll live his days where the sunbeams start, Nor could storm or wind uproot him. My own dear love, he is all my heart, -- And I wish somebody'd shoot him.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Sacred Wood
Quote: No poet, no artist of any art, has his complete meaning alone. His significance, his appreciation is the appreciation of his relation to the dead poets and artists. You cannot value him alone; you must set him, for contrast and comparison, among the dead.

Author: Sara Teasdale,  Rivers to the Sea
Quote: I shall have peace, as leafy trees are peaceful When rain bends down the bough; And I shall be more silent and cold-hearted Than you are now.

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
Quote: Poetry is a mirror which makes beautiful that which is distorted

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Poetic inspiration is all around us, and it surrounds us like silent music that makes our hearts vibrate. Any time you give or receive love, you are a part of a living poem.

Author: Andrew Marvell,  To His Coy Mistress
Quote: Had we but world enough and time, This coyness, lady, were no crime. We would sit down, and think which way To walk, and pass our long love’s day.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: down with hell and heaven and all the religious fussinfinity pleased our parents one inch looks good to us

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: There is another alphabet, whispering from every leaf, singing from every river, shimmering from every sky.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  The Harp-Weaver and Other Poems
Quote: I will come back to you, I swear I will;And you will know me still.I shall be only a little tallerThan when I went.

Author: Mahmoud Darwish
Quote: خضراء أكتبها على نثر السنابل في كتاب الحقل ، قوّسها امتلاءٌ شاحبٌ فيها وفي. وكلما صادقت أو آخيت سنبلةً تعلّمت البقاء من الفناء وضده. أنا حبة القمح التي ماتت لكي تخضرّ ثانية وفي موتي حياةٌ ما

Author: Philip Larkin,  Collected Poems
Quote: Uncontradicting solitudeSupports me on its giant palm;And like a sea-anemoneOr simple snail, there cautiouslyUnfolds, emerges, what I am.

Author: Paul Valéry,  The Art of Poetry
Quote: Nothing is more natural than mutual misunderstanding; the contrary is always surprising. I believe that one never agrees on anything except by mistake, and that all harmony among human beings is the happy fruit of an error.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense
Quote: girlsplease give yourbodies and yourlivestothe young menwhodeserve thembesidesthere isno wayI would welcometheintolerabledullsenseless hellyou would bringmeandI wish youluckin bedandoutbut notinminethankyou.

Author: Billy Collins,  The Trouble With Poetry - And Other Poems
Quote: I could feel the day offering itself to me,and I wanted nothing morethan to be in the moment-but which moment?Not that one, or that one, or that one,

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  Poems of Fernando Pessoa
Quote: Lord, may the pain be ours, And the weakness that it brings, But at least give us the strength, Of not showing it to anyone!

Author: Gwendolyn Brooks,  Annie Allen
Quote: Exhaust the little moment. Soon it dies.And be it gash or gold it will not comeAgain in this identical disguise.

Author: John Donne,  The Complete English Poems
Quote: And to 'scape stormy days, I choose an everlasting night.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
Quote: No man was ever yet a great poet, without at the same time being a profound philosopher.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sun Watches the Sun
Quote: Even if you are alone you wage war with yourself.

Author: Anne Stevenson
Quote: Mind led bodyto the edge of the precipice.They stared in desireat the naked abyss.If you love me, said mind,take that step into silence.If you love me, said body,turn and exist.

Author: Czesław Miłosz
Quote: You see how I tryTo reach with wordsWhat matters mostAnd how I fail.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I should combine a car bumper with a belt, for a fashion accessory that’s safe for office romances. Powdered love poetry sold separately.

Author: Mark Strand,  Selected Poems
Quote: Even this late it happens:the coming of love, the coming of light.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Sometimes with one I love, I fill myself with rage, for fear I effuse unreturn'd love; But now I think there is no unreturn'd love—the pay is certain, one way or another; (I loved a certain person ardently, and my love was not return'd; Yet out of that, I have written these songs.)

Author: Craig Ferguson
Quote: Twas the night before Thanksgiving. All the food's in the oven. And I'm in the bedroom performin' self lovin'.

Author: Billy Collins,  Picnic, Lightning
Quote: It is time to float on the waters of the night. Time to wrap my arms around this book and press it to my chest, life preserver in a sea of unremarkable men and women, anonymous faces on the street, a hundred thousand unalphabetized things, a million forgotten hours.

Author: Kim Addonizio
Quote: Love me like a wrong turn on a bad roadlate at night.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Rime of the Ancient Mariner
Quote: Alone, alone, all, all alone, Alone on a wide wide sea! And never a saint took pity on My soul in agony.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Edgar Allan Poe: Selected Poems
Quote: You call it hope — that fire of fire!It is but agony of desire.

Author: Friedrich Schiller
Quote: There are three lessons I would write-Three words, as with a burning pen, In tracings of eternal light,Upon the heart of men.Have hope! though clouds environ round,And gladness hides her face in scorn,Put thou the shadow from thy brow,No night but hath its morn.Have love! not love alone for one, But man as man thy brother call,And scatter like the circling sun,Thy charities on all.

Author: William Blake
Quote: The lamb misused breeds public strifeAnd yet forgives the butcher's knife.

Author: W.S. Merwin,  The Shadow of Sirius
Quote: part memory part distance remainingmine in the ways that I learn to miss you

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Every beginning has an end and every end has a new beginning, don't worry, broken soul, life will one day come to an end.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: To risk life to save a smile on a face of a woman or a child is the secret of chivalry.

Author: William Cowper,  The Poetical Works Of William Cowper
Quote: God moves in mysterious waysHis wonders to performs

Author: Dorothy Parker
Quote: It costs me never a stab nor squirm / To tread by chance upon a worm. / Aha, my little dear, / I say, Your clan will pay me back one day.

Author: Marina Tsvetaeva
Quote: Don't you know no one can escapethe power of creatures reaching outwith breath alone?

Author: Santōka Taneda,  Mountain Tasting: Haiku and Journals of Santoka Taneda
Quote: Haiku is not a shriek, a howl, a sigh, or a yawn; rather, it is the deep breath of life.

Author: Graham Chapman
Quote: McGough: I'm sorry. I'm afraid I've caught poetry. Mr Bones: Oh really? Well, don't worry, sir - I used to suffer from short stories.McGough: Really? When?Mr Bones: Oh, once upon a time ...

Author: Amy Lowell
Quote: A black cat among roses,phlox, lilac-misted under a quarter moon,the sweet smells of heliotrope and night-scented stock. The garden is very still.It is dazed with moonlight,contented with perfume...

Author: Gary D. Schmidt,  Okay for Now
Quote: You know, there are good reasons to learn how to read. Poetry isn't one of them. I mean, so what if two roads go two ways in a wood? So what? Who cares if it made all that big a difference? What difference? And why should I have to guess what the difference is? Isn't that what he's supposed to say?Why can't poets just say what they want to say and then shut up?

Author: Muriel Rukeyser
Quote: No one wants to read poetry. You have to make it impossible for them to put the poem down--impossible for them to stop reading it, word after word. You have to keep them from closing the book.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  Flower-de-Luce, and the Masque of Pandora
Quote: Resolve, and thou art free.

Author: John Clare,  "I Am": The Selected Poetry of John Clare
Quote: I am—yet what I am none cares or knows; My friends forsake me like a memory lost: I am the self-consumer of my woes— They rise and vanish in oblivious host, Like shadows in love’s frenzied stifled throes And yet I am, and live—like vapours tossed

Author: Paul Verlaine,  One Hundred and One Poems by Paul Verlaine: A Bilingual Edition
Quote: Il pleure dans mon coeurComme il pleut sur la ville.Tears are shed in my heart like the rain on the town.

Author: John Donne,  The Complete English Poems
Quote: Love's mysteries in souls do grow,But yet the body is his book.

Author: Katerina Stoykova Klemer,  The air around the butterfly/Въздухът около пеперудата
Quote: How to Write a PoemCatch the airaround the butterfly.

Author: Holly Black,  Valiant
Quote: One fine day, in the middle of the night, two dead boys got up to fight. Back to back they faced each other. They pulled out their swords and shot one another. One deaf cop, on the beat heard the noise, and came and shot the two dead boys.

Author: Andrea Gibson
Quote: We are all instruments pulling the bows across our own lungs. Windmills, still startling in every storm. Have you ever seen a newborn blinking at the light? I wanna do that every day. I wanna know what the kite called itself when it got away, when it escaped into the night...

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Selected Letters of Virginia Woolf
Quote: My brain hums with scraps of poetry and madness.

Author: Gabriela Mistral
Quote: You shall create beauty not to excite the sensesbut to give sustenance to the soul.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own
Quote: It is strange how a scrap of poetry works in the mind and makes the legs move in time to it along the road.

Author: Craig Ferguson
Quote: I've got mixed feelings about poetry cause done well poetry is fantastic. But not many people are capable of doing it well. I think you should have some kind of license to perform poetry. A poetic license perhaps.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: Our love was bornoutside the walls,in the wind,in the night,in the earth,and that's why the clay and the flower,the mud and the rootsknow your name.

Author: Virgil,  Eclogues. Georgics. Aeneid: Books 1-6
Quote: forsan et haec olim meminisse iuvabit.and perhaps it will be pleasing to have remembered these things one day

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti,  Wild Dreams of a New Beginning
Quote: We have seen the best minds of our generation destroyed by boredom at poetry readings.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: She dealt her pretty words like Blades --How glittering they shone --And every One unbared a NerveOr wantoned with a Bone --She never deemed -- she hurt --That -- is not Steel's Affair --A vulgar grimace in the Flesh --How ill the Creatures bear --To Ache is human -- not polite --The Film upon the eyeMortality's old Custom --Just locking up -- to Die.

Author: Lucille Clifton
Quote: won't you celebrate with mewhat i have shaped intoa kind of life? i had no model.born in babylonboth nonwhite and womanwhat did i see to be except myself?i made it uphere on this bridge betweenstarshine and clay,my one hand holding tightmy other hand; come celebratewith me that everydaysomething has tried to kill meand has failed.

Author: A. Saleh,  Poetry Eyes
Quote: When you write about what you dream, you become a writer.When you dream about what you write, you become haunted by a curse.

Author: Naomi Shihab Nye,  Red Suitcase
Quote: Anyone who says, “Here’s my address,write me a poem,” deserves something in reply.So I’ll tell a secret instead:poems hide. In the bottoms of our shoes,they are sleeping. They are the shadowsdrifting across our ceilings the moment before we wake up. What we have to dois live in a way that lets us find them.

Author: Hāfez,  The Rubaiyat of Hafiz
Quote: When no one is looking,I swallow deserts and cloudsand chew on mountainsknowing they are sweet bones!When no one is lookingand I want to kiss God,I just lift my own hand to my mouth.

Author: Ted Hughes
Quote: The inmost spirit of poetry, in other words, is at bottom, in every recorded case, the voice of pain – and the physical body, so to speak, of poetry, is the treatment by which the poet tries to reconcile that pain with the world.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Maybe I hope too much. Maybe I dream too much or maybe I love too much to just give up on you.

Author: Joseph Campbell,  Thou Art That: Transforming Religious Metaphor
Quote: How does the ordinary person come to the transcendent? For a start, I would say, study poetry. Learn how to read a poem. You need not have the experience to get the message, or at least some indication of the message. It may come gradually. (92)

Author: Aleister Crowley,  The Scented Garden Of Abdullah The Satirist Of Shiraz
Quote: Some men are born sodomites, some achieve sodomy, and some have sodomy thrust upon them...

Author: Seamus Heaney,  Opened Ground: Selected Poems, 1966-1996
Quote: Between my finger and my thumb The squat pen rests; snug as a gun.

Author: Gerard Manley Hopkins,  Gerard Manley Hopkins: The Complete Poems
Quote: What would the world be, once bereft Of wet and of wildness? Let them be left, O let them be left, wildness and wet; Long live the weeds and the wilderness yet.

Author: Christina Rossetti,  The Poetical Works of Christina Georgina Rossetti
Quote: In the bleak midwinter Frosty wind made moan, Earth stood hard as iron, Water like a stone; Snow had fallen, Snow on snow, Snow on snow, In the bleak midwinter, Long ago.

Author: Ted Kooser
Quote: Valentine's Day is the poet's holiday.

Author: Frank O'Hara
Quote: That's not a run in your stocking, it's a hand on your leg.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: She was broken from moment to moment, watching her world collide she felt lost inside herself. She fell apart for a passion that flamed beneath her. She waited and died a hundred times, it dripped from her pores. The moment she let go, she soared over the stillness like the star she was born to be.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: It was never about the world being too big, it was more like she was too much for the world to handle.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  Selected Poems
Quote: Wild Nights – Wild Nights!Were I with theeWild Nights should beOur luxury!Futile – the winds –To a heart in port –Done with the compass –Done with the chart!Rowing in Eden –Ah, the sea!Might I moor – Tonight –In thee!

Author: Christopher Morley
Quote: The courage of the poet is to keep ajar the door that leads into madness.

Author: Amy Lowell
Quote: For books are more than books, they are the lifeThe very heart and core of ages past,The reason why men lived and worked and died,The essence and quintessence of their lives.

Author: Ernest Dowson,  The Poems and Prose of Ernest Dowson
Quote: They are not long, the days of wine and roses:Out of a misty dreamOur path emerges for awhile, then closesWithin a dream.

Author: Robert Browning
Quote: Take away love and our earth is a tomb.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: Words rich in meaning can be cheap in sound effects.

Author: Robert Browning
Quote: The rain set early in tonight,The sullen wind was soon awake,It tore the elm-tops down for spite,And did its best to vex the lake:I listened with heart fit to break.When glided in Porphyria; straightShe shut the cold out and the storm,And kneeled and made the cheerless grateBlaze up and all the cottage warm;

Author: Edmond Rostand,  Cyrano de Bergerac
Quote: ...But...to sing,to dream, to smile, to walk, to be alone, be free,with a voice that stirs and an eye that still can see!To cock your hat to one side, when you pleaseat a yes, a no, to fight, or- make poetry!To work without a thought of fame or fortune,on that journey, that you dream of, to the moon!Never to write a line that's not your own...

Author: Sonia Sanchez
Quote: Come windless invaderI am a carnival ofStars, a poem of blood.

Author: Octavio Paz,  The Other Voice: Essays on Modern Poetry
Quote: This is perhaps the most noble aim of poetry, to attach ourselves to the world around us, to turn desire into love, to embrace, finally what always evades us, what is beyond, but what is always there – the unspoken, the spirit, the soul.

Author: Emily Brontë,  Poems by Currer, Ellis, and Acton Bell
Quote: And, even yet, I dare not let it languish,Dare not indulge in memory’s rapturous pain;Once drinking deep of that divinest anguish,How could I seek the empty world again?

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: She wildly burned for the one she loved and he stood there watching, hoping he too would catch a blaze from the violence stirring in her heart.

Author: Louise Glück,  Vita Nova
Quote: The master said You must write what you see.But what I see does not move me.The master answered Change what you see.

Author: David Carradine
Quote: If you cannot be a poet, be the poem.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: Sometimes I dreamthat everything in the world is here, in my room, in a great closet, named and orderly,and I am here too, in front of it, hardly able to see for the flash and the brightness—and sometimes I am that madcap person clapping my hands and singing; and sometimes I am that quiet person down on my knees.

Author: Honoré de Balzac
Quote: Love is the poetry of the senses!

Author: John Dryden
Quote: I am sore wounded but not slainI will lay me down and bleed a whileAnd then rise up to fight again

Author: Rumi
Quote: Soul receives from soul that knowledge, therefore not by book nor from tongue. If knowledge of mysteries come after emptiness of mind, that is illumination of heart.

Author: Sanober Khan,  A Thousand Flamingos
Quote: Sometimes I think,I need a spare heart to feel all the things I feel.

Author: Marvin Bell,  Mars Being Red
Quote: The war to preserve the privilege of mythmaking

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: Wordsare powerfulforces of nature.they are destruction.they are nourishment. they are flesh. they are water.they are flowers and bone.they burn. they cleansethey erase. they etch. they can eitherleave youfeelinghomelessor brimmingwith home.

Author: Sara Teasdale,  Love Songs
Quote: WisdomWhen I have ceased to break my wings Against the faultiness of things, And learned that compromises wait Behind each hardly opened gate, When I can look Life in the eyes, Grown calm and very coldly wise, Life will have given me the Truth, And taken in exchange -- my youth.

Author: Joss Whedon
Quote: My soul is wrapped in harsh repose,Midnight descends in raven-colored clothes,But soft... behold!A sunlight beamButting a swath of glimmering gleam.My heart expands,'tis grown a bulge in it,Inspired by your beauty...Effulgent.

Author: C.D. Wright,  Cooling Time: An American Poetry Vigil
Quote: Poetry is the language of intensity. Because we are going to die, an expression of intensity is justified.

Author: Billy Joel
Quote: We didn't start the fireIt was always burningSince the world's been turningWe didn't start the fireNo we didn't light itBut we tried to fight it

Author: Naomi Shihab Nye
Quote: I Still Have Everything You Gave MeIt is dusty on the edges.It is slightly rotten.I guard it without thinking.I focus on it once a yearwhen I shake it out in the wind.I do not ache.I would not trade.

Author: Philip Larkin,  High Windows
Quote: Rather than words comes the thought of high windows:The sun-comprehending glass,And beyond it, the deep blue air, that showsNothing, and is nowhere, and is endless.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  Raise High the Roof Beam, Carpenters & Seymour: An Introduction
Quote: John Keats / John Keats / John / Please put your scarf on.

Author: Umberto Eco,  Postscript to the Name of the Rose
Quote: Rem tene, verba sequentur: grasp the subject, and the words will follow. This, I believe, is the opposite of what happens with poetry, which is more a case of verba tene, res sequenter: grasp the words, and the subject will follow.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: She needed the chaos within her in order to discover the extraordinary no man could ever reach.

Author: Gwendolyn Brooks,  Selected Poems
Quote: We real cool. We Left school. We Lurk late. We Strike straight. We Sing sin. We Thin gin. We Jazz June. We Die soon.

Author: Seamus Heaney
Quote: All I know is a door into the dark

Author: Milan Kundera
Quote: The characters in my novels are my own unrealised possibilities. That is why I am equally fond of them all and equally horrified by them. Each one has crossed a border that I myself have circumvented.

Author: Jack Kerouac,  Mexico City Blues
Quote: I'd rather be thin than famousbut I'm fatpaste that in your broadway show

Author: José Martí,  Versos Sencillos: Simple Verses
Quote: A grain of poetry suffices to season a century.

Author: John Adams,  The Letters of John and Abigail Adams
Quote: You will never be alone with a poet in your pocket.

Author: Naomi Shihab Nye,  Salting the Ocean: 100 Poems by Young Poets
Quote: you will never catch up.Walk around feeling like a leafknow you could tumble at any second.Then decide what to do with your time.--The Art of Disappearing

Author: Katerina Stoykova Klemer
Quote: Writing is not a matter of time, but a matter or of space. If you don't keep space in your head for writing, you won't write even if you have the time.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: Green in nature is one thing, green in literature another. Nature and letters seem to have a natural antipathy; bring them together and they tear each other to pieces.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  Selected Poems
Quote: Inebriate of Air — am I —And Debauchee of Dew —Reeling — thro endless summer days —From Inns of Molten Blue —

Author: Amy Lowell
Quote: You are ice and fire The touch of you burns my hands like snow

Author: Robert Frost,  The Poetry of Robert Frost
Quote: Fireflies in the GardenBy Robert Frost 1874–1963 Here come real stars to fill the upper skies, And here on earth come emulating flies, That though they never equal stars in size, (And they were never really stars at heart) Achieve at times a very star-like start. Only, of course, they can't sustain the part.

Author: Pat Conroy,  Beach Music
Quote: Writing poetry and reading books causes brain damage.

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley,  Prometheus Unbound
Quote: When soul meets soul on lovers' lips.

Author: Billy Collins,  The Apple That Astonished Paris
Quote: all they want to dois tie the poem to a chair with ropeand torture a confession out of it.They begin beating it with a hoseto find out what it really means.

Author: Paul Éluard
Quote: There is another world, and it is in this one.

Author: Theodore Roethke,  The Collected Poems
Quote: I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow. I feel my fate in what I cannot fear. I learn by going where I have to go.

Author: George Orwell,  Keep the Aspidistra Flying
Quote: He drove his mind into the abyss where poetry is written.

Author: Joy Harjo
Quote: There is no poetry where there are no mistakes.

Author: Leonard Nimoy,  Come Be With Me: A Collection of Poems
Quote: Rocket shipsare excitingbut so are roseson a birthday.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  Mine the Harvest
Quote: And must I then, indeed, Pain, live with youall through my life?-sharing my fire, my bed,Sharing-oh, worst of all things!-the same head?-And, when I feed myself, feeding you too?

Author: Wallace Stevens
Quote: One must read poetry with one's nerves.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: Poetry is a life-cherishing force.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: I believe in the flesh and the appetites; Seeing, hearing, feeling, are miracles, and each part and tag of me is a miracle. Divine am I inside and out, and I make holy whatever I touch or am touch’d from;The scent of these arm-pits, aroma finer than prayer; This head more than churches, bibles, and all the creeds.

Author: Ellen Kennedy
Quote: i don't want to hate the presidenti don't want to go to harvardi don't want to win the pulitzer prizei just want to sit in my bathtuband think about relationships i will never havewith people i will never meetand then go lay in my bedwith a magnifying glassand count all the stiches in my sheetsuntil i fall asleepand wake upto repeat again.

Author: Margaret Atwood,  Procedures For Underground
Quote: Where do the words gowhen we have said them?

Author: Helen Keller,  The Story of My Life: With Her Letters (1887 1901) and a Supplementary Account of Her Education Including Passages from the Reports and Letters of Her Teacher Anne Mansfield Sullivan by John Albert Macy
Quote: Great poetry needs no interpreter other than a responsive heart.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: This poetry. I never know what I'm going to say.I don't plan it.When I'm outside the saying of it,I get very quiet and rarely speak at all.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Its dark and I’m reading my scars because our moments remind me of where I should be.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: even in the loneliest momentsi have been therefor myself.

Author: Christina Rossetti
Quote: Love shall be our token; love be yours and love be mine.

Author: حافظ
Quote: Good poetry makes the universe reveal a secret.

Author: Sappho,  If Not, Winter: Fragments of Sappho
Quote: In fact she herself once blamed meKyprogeneiabecause I prayed this word:I want.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Doubt not, O poet, but persist. Say 'It is in me, and shall out.' Stand there, balked and dumb, stuttering and stammering, hissed and hooted, stand and strive, until at last rage draw out of thee that dream-power which every night shows thee is thine own; a power transcending all limit and privacy, and by virtue of which a man is the conductor of the whole river of electricity.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Shakespeare's Sonnets
Quote: All days are nights to see till I see thee, And nights bright days when dreams do show thee me.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sun Watches the Sun
Quote: You not only are hunted by others, you unknowingly hunt yourself.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: You’re not a bad person, you’re just a little bit different and I’m a sucker for that.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense
Quote: sometimes when everything seems atits worstwhen all conspiresand gnawsand the hours, days, weeksyearsseem wasted – stretched there upon my bedin the darklooking upward at the ceilingi get what many will consider anobnoxious thought:it’s still nice to beBukowski.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  A Few Figs from Thistles
Quote: Second FigSafe upon the solid rock the ugly houses stand: Come and see my shining palace built upon the sand!

Author: Sanober Khan,  Turquoise Silence
Quote: because some thingssometimesaren't ours to hold,but just beautiful to listen to.

Author: Dylan Thomas
Quote: I sang in my chains like the sea

Author: Louise Glück,  Triumph of Achilles
Quote: Why love what you will lose?There is nothing else to love.

Author: Pablo Neruda
Quote: Escóndeme en tus brazospor esta noche sola,mientras la lluvia rompecontra el mar y la tierrasu boca innumerable.

Author: Vikram Chandra,  Red Earth and Pouring Rain
Quote: Ask him why there are hypocrites in the world.''Because it is hard to bear the happiness of others.''When are we happy?''When we desire nothing and realize that possession is only momentary, and so are forever playing.''What is regret?''To realize that one has spent one's life worrying about the future.''What is sorrow?''To long for the past.''What is the highest pleasure?''To hear a good story.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Maybe love was meant to save us from ourselves.

Author: W.S. Merwin,  The Lice
Quote: My words are the garment of what I shall never be Like the tucked sleeve of a one-armed boy.

Author: Kathryn Lasky,  The Capture
Quote: Flutter like a hummingbird, Dive like an eagle, Ain't no bird that's my equal. - Twilight

Author: Andrew Marvell,  To His Coy Mistress
Quote: Thus, though we cannot make our sun Stand still, yet we will make him run.

Author: Fran Lebowitz,  Metropolitan Life/Social Studies
Quote: If you are of the opinion that the contemplation of suicide is sufficient evidence of a poetic nature, do not forget that actions speak louder than words.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  Selected Poems
Quote: One need not be a Chamber — to be Haunted — One need not be a House — The Brain has Corridors — surpassing Material Place —

Author: Dorianne Laux,  The Poet's Companion: A Guide To The Pleasures Of Writing Poetry
Quote: We aren't suggesting that mental instability or unhappiness makes one a better poet, or a poet at all; and contrary to the romantic notion of the artist suffering for his or her work, we think these writers achieved brilliance in spite of their suffering, not because of it.

Author: Charles Baudelaire
Quote: And, drunk with my own madness, I shouted at him furiously, "Make life beautiful! Make life beautiful!

Author: Mark Strand,  The Late Hour
Quote: The Coming of LightEven this late it happens:the coming of love, the coming of light. You wake and the candles are lit as if by themselves, stars gather, dreams pour into your pillows, sending up warm bouquets of air.Even this late the bones of the body shine and tomorrow’s dust flares into breath.

Author: Roger Zelazny,  Isle of the Dead
Quote: I watched the spinning stars, grateful, sad and proud, as only a man who has outlived his destiny and realizes he might yet forge himself another, can be.

Author: John Dryden,  All for Love
Quote: Errors, like straws, upon the surface flow; He who would search for pearls, must dive below.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Edgar Allan Poe: Selected Poems
Quote: And the Raven, never flitting, still is sitting, still is sitting On the pallid bust of Pallas just above my chamber door; And his eyes have all the seeming of a demon's that is dreaming, And the lamp-light o'er him streaming throws his shadow on the floor:And my soul from out that shadow that lies floating on the floor Shall be lifted — nevermore!

Author: Christina Rossetti,  The Complete Poems
Quote: I lock my door upon myself, And bar them out; but who shall wall Self from myself, most loathed of all?

Author: Miroslav Antić
Quote: Ali ipak uz mene se može, mada je neobično, Sa mnom je opasno hteti, ja nikad ne odustajem.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: Birds are flyin' south for winter.Here's the Weird-Bird headin' north,Wings a-flappin', beak a-chatterin',Cold head bobbin' back 'n' forth.He says, "It's not that I like iceOr freezin' winds and snowy ground.It's just sometimes it's kind of niceTo be the only bird in town.

Author: Charlotte Eriksson
Quote: I am a free soul, singing my heart out by myself no matter where I go and I call strangers my friends because I learn things and find ways to fit them into my own world. I hear what people say, rearrange it, take away and tear apart until it finds value in my reality and there I make it work. I find spaces in between the cracks and cuts where it feels empty and there I make it work.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
Quote: Writing, then, was a substitute for myself: if you don't love me, love my writing & love me for my writing. It is also much more: a way of ordering and reordering the chaos of experience.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.

Author: Li-Young Lee
Quote: I am that last, thatfinal thing, the bodyin a white sheet listening,

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Obscurity
Quote: Not everything can be felt and not everything will be ever understood.

Author: William Carlos Williams
Quote: If it ain't a pleasure, it ain't a poem.

Author: Otto René Castillo
Quote: But I don't shut up and I don't die.I liveand fight, maddeningthose who rule my country.For if I liveI fight,and if I fightI contribute to the dawn.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: I know how you feel because I’ve been there too. I’ve hated and I’ve loved. I’ve seen my demons root and crawl and my angels branch and soar. I've died within myself and lived a thousand different lives. I too fight the same war and I too am drowning in the puddles of self-consciousness this world created.

Author: W.B. Yeats,  The Winding Stair and Other Poems
Quote: I sat, a solitary man,In a crowded London shop,An open book and empty cupOn the marble table-top.While on the shop and street I gazedMy body of a sudden blazed;And twenty minutes more or lessIt seemed, so great my happiness,That I was blessed and could bless.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Rilke's Book of Hours: Love Poems to God
Quote: If we surrenderedto earth’s intelligencewe could rise up rooted, like trees.Instead we entangle ourselvesin knots of our own makingand struggle, lonely and confused.So like children, we begin again...to fall,patiently to trust our heaviness.Even a bird has to do thatbefore he can fly.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: Free verse is like free love; it is a contradiction in terms.

Author: Jane Austen,  Persuasion
Quote: she thought it was the misfortune of poetry, to be seldom safely enjoyed by those who enjoyed it completely; and that the strong feelings which alone could estimate it truly, were the very feelings which ought to taste it but sparingly.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: Pirate Captain Jim"Walk the plank,"says Pirate Jim"But Captain Jim, I cannot swim.""Then you must steer us through the gale.""But Captain Jim, I cannot sail.""Then down with the galley slaves you go.""But Captain Jim, I cannot row.""Then you must be the pirate's clerk.""But Captain Jim, I cannot work.

Author: Ally Condie,  Matched
Quote: at first when the rain fell from the sky so wide and deepit smelled like sage, my favorite smellI went up on the plateau to watch it cometo see the gifts it always broughtbut this rain changed from blue to black and leftnothing.

Author: Sappho
Quote: Eros, again now, the loosener of limbs troubles me,Bittersweet, sly, uncontrollable creature….

Author: Pablo Neruda,  Odes to Common Things
Quote: So the freshness lives onin a lemon,in the sweet-smelling house of the rind,the proportions, arcane and acerb.

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: If my poetry aims to achieve anything, it's to deliver people from the limited ways in which they see and feel.

Author: C. P. Klapper,  The Washington Poems
Quote: Romantic haste in drama bringstears and sighs when the hero diesbut the curtain fall is finalwhen in life we take the tragic wayThe sunset too is a glorious thingbut with it ends the day.

Author: Stanley Kunitz,  The Collected Poems
Quote: In my darkest night,when the moon was coveredand I roamed through wreckage,a nimbus-clouded voicedirected me:“Live in the layers,not on the litter.”Though I lack the artto decipher it,no doubt the next chapterin my book of transformationsis already written.I am not done with my changes.

Author: George Gordon Byron,  Manfred: A Dramatic Poem
Quote: The stars are forth, the moon above the topsOf the snow-shining mountains.—Beautiful!I linger yet with Nature, for the nightHath been to me a more familiar faceThan that of man; and in her starry shadeOf dim and solitary loveliness,I learn'd the language of another world.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: I am solitary as grass. What is it I miss?Shall I ever find it, whatever it is?

Author: May Sarton
Quote: Where music thundered let the mind be still,Where the will triumphed let there be no will,What light revealed, now let the dark fulfill.

Author: Roman Payne,  Rooftop Soliloquy
Quote: So the nymphs they spoke,we kissed and laid.By noontime’s hourour love was made.Like braided chains of crocus stems,we lay entwined, I laid with them.Our breath, one glassy, tideless sea,our bodies draping wearily,we slept, I slept so lucidly,with hopes to stay this memory.

Author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
Quote: We flatter those we scarcely know,We please the fleeting guest;And deal full many a thoughtless blow,To those who love us best.

Author: Adrienne Rich
Quote: and I ask myself and you, which of our visions will claim uswhich will we claimhow will we go on livinghow will we touch, what will we knowwhat will we say to each other.

Author: Arakida Moritake,  Traditional Japanese Poetry: An Anthology
Quote: A fallen blossomreturning to the bough, I thought --But no, a butterfly.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: I have been happy, though in a dream.I have been happy-and I love the theme:Dreams! in their vivid colouring of lifeAs in that fleeting, shadowy, misty strife

Author: Sanober Khan,  A Thousand Flamingos
Quote: sometimes i don't know, which momentwhich cool gust of wind will come,and enchant metousling my hairand my heart, stirring...that familiar ache of poetry, which drop will kissthe old wrench in my soulreminding me, all over againi miss you better in the rain.

Author: Adrienne Rich
Quote: Love, our subject:we've trained it like ivy to our walls.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  Sand and Foam
Quote: Poetry is a deal of joy and pain and wonder, with a dash of the dictionary.

Author: Pable Neruda
Quote: Well, now,if little by little you stop loving meI shall stop loving you little by little.If suddenlyyou forget medo not look for me,for I shall already have forgotten you.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: We talk so abstractly about poetry because all of us are usually bad poets.

Author: Dante Alighieri,  The Divine Comedy
Quote: Those ancients who in poetry presented the golden age, who sang its happy state,perhaps, in their Parnassus, dreamt this place. Here, mankind's root was innocent; and herewere every fruit and never-ending spring; these streams--the nectar of which poets sing.

Author: Federico García Lorca
Quote: Verde que te quiero verde. Verde viento. Verdes ramas. El barco sobre la mar y el caballo en la montaña.

Author: Luís Vaz de Camões,  Sonetos de Camões
Quote: Times change, as do our wills, What we are - is ever changing; All the world is made of change, And forever attaining new qualities.

Author: Frank O'Hara
Quote: Oh! kangaroos, sequins, chocolate sodas! / You really are beautiful! Pearls, / harmonicas, jujubes, aspirins!

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
